item.name: 10 Days in Europe
item.comment:
Bianca loves this one so I'm willing to play it for her. But I really don't like it.
There's not much to this game. It's kind of like a puzzle in which you hope to draw the right cards. I know it's only a filler, but I can think of literally 100 games I'd rather play.

item.name: 1812: The Invasion of Canada
item.comment: This game is maddening! The variable turn order is both genius and diabolical. It can create some really weird swings in fortune. I love how the dice work as it forces some real choices when losing units. The cardplay is also quite good, but most of the cards are fairly similar. I'd like to have a bit more variety.

item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment:
BGG Secret Santa 2007
This is a great 2-player game. Lots of tension because a lot of the game feels like tug-o-war. Some may find it repetitive, but every game has worked out differently for me.

item.name: 2 de Mayo
item.comment:
Blind simultaneous movement and simplified game rules create a fantastic game of cat and mouse. It's a very simple game, but it's by no means easy or boring. There's a tight time limit to the game and every move is a struggle. Advantages can be gained or lost in a moment with good decision making.
This is NOT a wargame, it's a hidden movement game that simulates a war effort. It's really quite good and for the length of game and weight, it's hard to find anything more entertaining.

item.name: 20th Century
item.comment:
I like this game! It's got 2 things I love: auctions and tile-laying. I really enjoy the way the auction rounds work and even more, I like the way the tile-placement goes. There's a lot going on here, but it's not hard to understand at all. The gameplay is intuitive and every choice is meaningful.
I'd love to get this one someday. I'll rate it a 7 for now and hope I get to play it more to increase that rating.

Its got the feel on No Thanks with much more meat. Very simple rules but lots of good decisions.
Purchased from Thor @ www.gamesurplus.com on 1/24/12.

item.name: 300: The Board Game
item.comment:
Not a bad little game although I'd say it was a bit simplistic. Luck is huge in this one.
You get a massive board that is hardly used at all, cards that are a bit thin, and a bunch of tokens.
I'd play it if asked, but I'd not like to own it again.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment:
Only one play in so far, but I think this one is really good. It's very simple to play, but there's a lot of choices in the game. I'm looking forward to more plays.
Our first game was with 7 and I was amazed at how well that actually worked. I can't wait to see how it handles less.
Purchased from Thor at Gamesurplus.com on 3/28/2011.
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: A great addition to a superb game engine. This both creates new strategies and opens options. I like the new guilds as well. If you own 7 wonders thus is a must have.

item.name: A la carte
item.comment:
Boring, boring, boring. Where is the game? This is just a really cute gimmick covering a non-existent game.
Purchased from Time Well Spent - February 2010

item.name: Abandon Ship
item.comment:
Knizia dicey goodness. Light and fun with quite the ability to screw over other players if you want to play nasty. This game has the worst board design EVER.
Received in a math trade 3/21/12

item.name: Acquire
item.comment:
I played my first game of this horrendously wrong, but I don't think it really matters. This game is good but not great.
Christmas Present 12/25/08

item.name: Admiral
item.comment:
This was the worst game I've ever played. EVER. It was roll and move with about the dumbest theme ever. The components were crap and the overall presentation was terrible.
Thank God I didn't pay for it.

item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
item.comment: Christmas Present for my wife 12/25/07 So many paths to victory and so many choices each turn. This game is mind-bogglingly deep.

item.name: Age of Steam
item.comment:
Purchased 3/18/09
What a truly awesome game. It's a brutal fight for every dollar. I believe that this game has a steep learning curve that provides and incredible reward for getting through it. Highly recommended for heavy gamers.
Given to my best friend in hopes that he will get to play it more than I do.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
This is a perfect example of a worker-placement game. Everything here works perfectly and the game is incredibly tight. They could realistically change the name of the game to Food because that's what it's all about for the first several rounds.
I think the family game is hardest because you don't get the cards to help you out.
I had this rated a 10 for quite a while. I do love it, but not quite that much anymore. Down to a 9 which is still quite awesome.
Purchased 8/12/08

item.name: Al Cabohne
item.comment: If you're looking for 2-player Bohnanza, this isn't it. Al Cabohne uses some of the same ideas but implements them very nicely. This is a great couples game because its light, but you can do some planning. Fun game.

item.name: Alchemist
item.comment: Christmas Present 12/25/07 Really fun game, its hard to describe how you actually play the game although the rules are quite simple.

item.name: Alea Iacta Est
item.comment:
I love dice games, but this one misses just a bit for me. I despised the special cards because I thought the iconography was terrible. So bad in fact that I stopped trying to get them because I couldn't be bothered to figure out what they meant. Second, I didn't like the blind draw of VPs on the one building. Third, it just seemed a bit mediocre to me.
If you want a dice game, then play Ra: The Dice Game. This one is okay and I'll play it if asked, but I wouldn't seek out a game of it.
Acquired in MT March 2011.

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment:
I like this game. Its really quite easy to play so it makes a great gateway game. Perhaps a bit too light for experienced gamers, its a solid game that you can enjoy without burning your brain. I compare it to Ticket to Ride although there is even less player interaction in this one.
Sold in my game auction December 2009 Re-acquired in a Math Trade January 2010. I like this game more than I thought. :) Sold again in my last game auction September 2010. I've owned this twice. I like it, but not enough to actually care.

item.name: Alhambra: The Dice Game
item.comment:
I love dice games and I think this one is pretty good. It's very simple, but the push-your-luck is perfect and the scoring is even better. I like this one a lot and look forward to owning a copy.
It's no Ra: The Dice Game, but it's an awesome option.
Purchased from CSI 5/12/2011.

item.name: Alibi
item.comment:
Alibi is a fun deduction/hand-management game that works well for large groups. It's easy to teach and fun to play. I think the game starts a bit slow but once it gets going it becomes an interesting game of choosing what you want your opponents to know.
I recommend this one for groups.
Christmas Present from DKahnt and his wife - 2008
Gifted to my buddy Rich - August 2011

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment:
Our first play left me a little underwhelmed. It seems a bit too easy with no real decisions to be made. Also, it felt like it was going to take way longer than it did which turned me off from the get-go.
I rate it a 6.5 after one play, but I don't have high hopes for this game. I'd rather play Ra: The Dice Game almost every single time. It's just a better game, no question about it.
Purchased from CSI on 4/25/2011
Sold in my game auction May 2011.

item.name: Amazing Space Venture
item.comment:
Oh God, what a terrible design. There's tile placement, but some of the tiles literally have to go in certain places, eliminating a lot of choice.
To be honest, I can't remember much of this one other than the choices were few and far between. It was just not good.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: I completely hated this one and I'm not even sure why. It's been far too long. Perhaps I should play it again.

item.name: Anathema
item.comment:
I like Casino, so it reasons that I like this game well enough. Some of the changes to scoring are good.
The card quality was terrible which put me off. I like the artwork and the presentation although some may find it to dark.

item.name: Android: Netrunner
item.comment:
I have everything before Future Proof, one of each set including the core set. I'm only trading it as complete.
I love the asymmetrical nature of this game.
Purchased from B&B on 9/18/12.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment:
This game is a bit of fun and some good laughs. However I don't really like party games. This game is actually quite ridiculous because you don't need to play a card that has anything to do with the topic to win. I'll play it if asked, but I really don't want to.
Christmas present 2010. Everyone else seems to like this so how bad can it be? Maybe it will get them wanting to play real games.
******EDIT******
I hate this if it lasts for more than 15 minutes. It's funny for like 3 rounds and then I just hate it. I'd rather sit and watch mens synchronized swimming.
Alas, I can't get rid of it because it was a christmas present from my best friend. Perhaps I should rethink that classification.

item.name: Aqu√§dukt
item.comment:
Purchased 6/6/07 This has a Settlers of Catan feel due to the die rolling. The game is pretty light, but its fun. Not too much though goes into the decisions but it keeps me interested. This can be a great couples game because there's not a lot of direct conflict.
************************EDIT***********************
This game is awesome. Yup, very very random with the placement of houses, but it can be NASTY. You have constant opportunities for screwage by diverting the aquadukts or filling areas that don't have water and making your opponents lose valuable houses. This is a deceptively simple little game that is much more than the sum of it's parts. A wonderful couples game if you don't mind a lot of direct screwage. I love how the die is used in this game. Really quite simple, but a truly awesome little game.
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009. Reacquired in May 2012. I missed this game and needed it back. Glad to have it again.

item.name: Aquarius
item.comment:
I should hate this game. It's chaotic, there's no ability to plan or control, and it's incredibly light. Strangely enough, I liked it quite a bit. I found the game to be a lot of fun and while I never felt like I had control, it never really bothered me.
The artwork on this game is great. It's simple, but the colors just pop out at you. It makes the game really nice on the table.
**********EDIT************
I've upped my rating to an 8. Why? This game is great! It's what Fluxx should have been: short, easy to teach and play, and visually attractive. It's a perfect quick game that you can teach to anyone.
Purchased at DexCon 7/8/11.

item.name: Archaeology: The Card Game
item.comment:
What a random disaster. Any planning is wiped out by the sandstorm and thief cards. The game quickly devolves into a draw-go situation as you have to collect cards for several turns.
This game has a great idea, but it's implemented very poorly.
Purchased from CSI late March 2010

item.name: Architekton
item.comment: A very simple two-player game. Some people say it's a brain burner, but I feel that there's really nothing here. It's boring and not particularly challenging. Not terrible and I'd play it if asked, but I'd rather play Carc or Fjords instead. Or almost anything else.

item.name: Arena: Roma II
item.comment:
A horrendously boring game which is based largely on luck. I don't like the way luck plays such a huge role in this game.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com 9/4/10

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment:
I finally got to play one of the all-time Ameritrash classics. It's so full of atmosphere which creates a great level of immersion. There's a nice story laid out every time you play it which gives you something to remember long after your session.
This game has a LOT of rules. It's long, and it's quite fiddly. If you can get past that it's fun. For me it's a bit of a turn off. That said I'd play this anytime with the right group of friends.
Acquired in a Math Trade 03/2011.
Traded on 8/09/11 for Call of Cthulhu LCG starter set which I think will see a lot more play.

item.name: Artus
item.comment:
This game is highly chaotic. The board constantly changes to the point where you almost can't think about your turn until it's literally your turn. It's also sort of a puzzle game in which you try to arrange your pieces so that you meet scoring conditions. If you can see what your opponents are doing, you'll have a good shot at scoring a lot of points.
I liked it as a 2-player but I have a hard time thinking it will be good with any more due to the chaos factor.
Christmas in July present from my Guantanamo Bay Secret Santa. Thanks, Santa!
This one lost it's charm. Traded away May 2012.

item.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
item.comment:
This game is fun and incredibly easy to teach. The setup is quick as well. I love the overall look of the cards and the quality of them as well.
I think there's a real game here, although it might need an expansion to flesh it out a bit.
Purchased from CSI - August 2010
Traded to epilgrim on 1/28/11. This game is a lot of fun, but my wife and I enjoy Resident Evil much more than any other deck-builder out there.

item.name: Assault on Hoth: The Empire Strikes Back
item.comment:
Is this anything new or innovative? Not at all. But it does an incredible job of recreating the battle for Hoth. I had so much fun playing this game and would gladly play it any time.
It would be spectacular to be able to replace some of the tokens with minis although it would cost a fortune.
Willing to trade well for this game.

item.name: At the Gates of Loyang
item.comment:
Loyang is almost a puzzle game. There's very little interaction so you're simply trying to do your stuff as well as possible. We need more plays, but it seems like you're trying to setup engines and maximize their output
This is easily the nicest looking game I've ever played, edging out the beautiful Finca by just a touch.
Received in trade from Joe Huber on 8/16/11
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: Atlantis
item.comment:
Something just does not feel right about this one to me. I blew my wife away in the first 2 game and I was the first player. This needs more plays to figure out what the problem is that I have.
EDIT******
I just played a solo game to see what we may have been doing wrong. I think the key to this game is that you can buy cards. In my solo game, I bought a lot of cards for both of the 2 "players". This really helped me to make better plays and to score more points. The scores were higher and the "player" that went second won. I'm seeing the potential here.

item.name: Aton
item.comment:
I love games where each player has the same deck and is tasked with using it differently. Aton presents great choices on every turn without being too thinky or dry. There's a lot of different ways to approach each turn which means that this is one game made up of a bunch of smaller games.
Received in the WBC No-Ship Math Trade - August 2011
Sold in my Fall auction 2011.

item.name: The Awful Green Things From Outer Space
item.comment:
Wow, this edition is gorgeous! Amazing quality, especially when you think about what this game is selling for.
Purchased from CSI 5/12/2011.
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment: I know that people claim there is skill in this. I disagree. It's not a bad way to spend time, but any game with that much dice rolling will result in random acts of stupidity.

item.name: Baker's Dozen
item.comment:
I like this game in any of its versions. It's a great hand-management game that really requires careful play. Sure, you'll have some bad luck here and there, but I truly believe most of it can be mitigated by how you choose to play your cards.
Highly recommended for almost any group.
Purchased 4/20/09

item.name: Balderdash
item.comment: My family destroyed this game. It eventually devolved to a point where stupidity became the game and while fun, it gets old after a while. This is a great game despite the fact that I don't really want to play it anymore.

item.name: Balloon Cup
item.comment:
For such a simple game, you are constantly having to make calculations and play constantly shifting odds. This is a pretty good game, but it's more thinky than it would first appear.
This is a new favorite of my wife. She's happy, I'm happy.
I think I should get this game at some point.
Acquired via Math Trade 03/2011.

item.name: Bananagrams
item.comment:
This is a great word game. It's really easy, plays fast, and is just simply fun. I like this one a lot, probably because it's simple and straightforward. You'll be amazed at just how often you find new ways to use tough letters. The ability to recreate your crossword as you get new letters is awesome.
Received a copy from the demo team at DexCon .7/8/2011
Traded away in a Math Trade.

item.name: Bandits
item.comment: A very simple card game that works well for kids. I like it enough to play it if asked, but only with kids. There are much better games to play with adults.

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: Play Shadow Hunters instead. Bang is terrible and takes far too long.

item.name: BANG! The Dice Game
item.comment: Fast and deadly. A perfect game for lunch.

item.name: Barista
item.comment: Terrible game with bad rules. The components were pretty nice but overall this was a pathetic dice game dressed up in pretty clothes.

item.name: Barons
item.comment:
This game feels like Race for the Galaxy but more fun. It's not as deep of a game, but the way you use cards for multiple purposes feels similar. There's a lot more "take that" here which some may not like. Also, you have to manage the actual space around your castle which I like.
A really interesting game that I'll certainly pick up once it's available again.
I had purchased this over the summer in 2011 but sold it in October 2011.

item.name: Batt'l Kha'os
item.comment:
Wow! What a wonderful little game. Easy rules with great choices to make. What seems like it would be too easy is actually perfect. I think I have found a new go-to game for my wife and I.
Christmas present 2009.
Sold in my Fall auction 2011.

item.name: The Battle at Kemble's Cascade
item.comment:
So much to like here. If you've ever played a scrolling shooter, this is exactly what you already know but ported from digital to analog. I was amazed at how well the spirit of those games was captured in Kemble's Cascade.
I think one of the things I really liked about this game is the fact that it's basically a constantly changing puzzle. It's got short-term strategy with a lot of tactics.
Even more, this game rewards timing and I think that's what really drives the game. Some people will complain about the PVP aspects, but those serve to drive timing. I really think it's pivotal to the game and not nearly as tacked on as it first appears.
I've been thinking about my first play constantly and can't wait to play it again.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment:
Purchased at 2007 WBC
A classic 2-player experience. I may be burning out a bit, but I still will play this anytime I'm asked. The rules are very easy but the decisions are what makes this one work. Its so tough to stay flexible while commiting to certain strategies.
EDIT 11/20/2014 After playing a bunch of Battle Line with my mom this week I have come to the conclusion that this is one of my all-time favorites. It's a perfect game for 2-players. I don't think anyone has ever done so much with so little.

item.name: Battleball
item.comment:
Battleball was more fun that Blood Bowl, but neither is very entertaining to me. I liked the way the dice worked in Battleball and the figures were quite cool looking.
Unfortunately, the game devolved into just smashing players without any sort of strategy.
I'd play if asked.

item.name: BattleCON: War of Indines
item.comment:
This game does a fantastic job of simulating an old-school fighting game. I really like that this game takes range into effect and allows you to play a positional game. That's a really great touch that gives this one character.
Speaking of characters, this game has a LOT of them! You've got a bevy of player choices and each of them is very unique. They've all got their own play styles and some great tricks that make them all feel unique. It's a real treat to have so many choices.
I'm only a few plays in, but I really like this one. I'm really looking forward to more opportunities to play this one.
Received a review copy on 2/29/12 from the designer.
Check out my review at www.theboardgamereviewer.com.
Traded in the July Math Trade.

item.name: Battleship
item.comment:
Such a simple game of guessing and deduction. It's not that bad. I'd still pick almost anything instead but I'd play if asked.
Purchased at Target - Fall 2008

item.name: Battleship Express
item.comment: A fairly weak dice-rolling game. It was pretty much a luck fest, but I think it was better than regular Battleship.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: BSG is one of the best games ever when it works. Unfortunately it doesn't work a lot of the time and you get boring games with long periods of nothing happening. I'd say the biggest knock against BSG is that it's inconsistent. It's like buying a car that runs like a champ 1 out of every 3 times you turn it on. You can only turn it on so many times before you get tired of wondering what you'll get.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica Collectible Card Game
item.comment:
They missed so bad on this game. The gameplay was weak and boring. It had damn near nothing to do with the actual show which was lame. I don't want to play this game, but I give it good marks for the great pictures.
I was really hoping this would be better.

item.name: Beep! Beep!
item.comment:
This is a terrific speed game that plays incredibly quickly. I love the racing aspect of the game. The Congestion rule is a nice feature as well.
If you like speed dexterity games then this is a great choice. It's relatively cheap too.
The one caveat I can give is that the cards will get destroyed. After 3 plays my copy already has several bent cards. Luckily it doesn't matter.
Bought at the WBC 2010.
Gifted to my buddy - August 2011

item.name: Before the Wind
item.comment:
Before the Wind is an interesting auction game because it forces you to decide between taking the largest value or taking a lesser value to deny someone the good they want. It's quite a neat system of extortion which works very well. The game isn't complicated, but there are a ton of cards to keep organized.
Received in a trade.

item.name: Belle of the Ball
item.comment: First play with 2 - not good at all. I think this will be much better with at least 3, probably 4 or 5 being best.

item.name: Beowulf: The Legend
item.comment: What an awesome variation on Taj Mahal. There's a considerable amount of luck but I find that it makes for really memorable moments. I love the hand management aspect of the game and how it greases the wheels at the cost of taking risks. It's a great design that is really tense. I think this has become a new favorite amongst Knizia games for me, but I likely won't play it much as the game really wants 4 players at minimum, just like Taj.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment:
Purchased at Toys R Us in early 2008 or late 2007
This is a great choice if you're looking for more of an experience than a game. You really are best off with at least 4 players IMO, but some people play with less. It would probably work, but there's much better choices for 2 or 3 players.
Sold in my game auction December 2009
Repurchased in December of 2010. I got a great price from Amazon and couldn't pass up the chance to own this one again.
Traded in May 2011 Math Trade.

item.name: Beyond Balderdash
item.comment: I think this game is better than the original because it adds variety to the game. Still, its gets silly in a hurry.

item.name: Big Boggle
item.comment:
My wife loves Boggle so I play it with her. I'm not a big fan, but I will say that I like Big Boggle way more than the basic version. I love the dice with 2 letters on them as that really opens things up.
I rate it a 6. I honestly think that I would rate it higher if I had tougher competition. When we play, its just a word finding exercise and nothing more.
Purchased from CSI on 4/25/2011

item.name: The Big Idea
item.comment: This game failed to be a party/bidding game by being un-fun. I had certain expectations that failed to come through.

item.name: Billionaire Banshee
item.comment: Easily one of the best party games I've ever played.

item.name: Bisikle
item.comment:
Flicking games bore the crap out of me. This one is as good as any other, but I find it gets quite tedious after a while.
Purchased from Gamesuplus.com April 6 2010.

item.name: Black Gold
item.comment:
Fantasy Flight has made a favorite of mine even better. The improvements over Giganten aren't many, but they're worth it. For starters, the board is modular! That's great in and of itself because the variety just got a huge increase. Also the increased player range will let me get this to the table a lot more often. Finally, the numerous variants in the rulebook will really spice things up.
The important part here is that they changed none of the key mechanics, keeping a great engine intact.
If you've ever wanted to own Giganten, buy Black Gold and get a better overall package.
Purchased from B&B 6/2011
Sold in my WBC aution 7/11

item.name: Blink
item.comment:
An incredibly quick and easy to play speed matching game. It's great for two players and you can handicap as much as you need to even the playing field. It's well worth the $5 you can buy it for.
Purchased from WalMart in 2008
Traded in Math Trade 5/2011

item.name: Blokus
item.comment:
Purchased from Deep Discount in 2007
My opinions on this game have steadily inclined. I have really grown to love this as a two-player and four-player. Constantly changing game reminds me of my favorite video game....Tetris.
I sold this in my game auction Sept 2009. Unfortunately, I can't find the damn thing. NO idea what happend to my copy. Bummer.

item.name: Blokus Duo
item.comment:
Wow this game is hard! It's a brilliant 2-player abstract that deserves a place in most game closets.
Beware trying to play this with a spouse/significant other. This game is highly confrontational because of how it's meant to be played.
Purchased 7/2/11

item.name: Blood Bowl (Third Edition)
item.comment: I really wanted to like this but instead of a football game you get a miniatures game with too many rules and not enough fun. I'd rather play BattleBall. At least that is quick and dirty. BloodBowl is too much like work to be fun.

item.name: Blood Bowl: Living Rulebook
item.comment:
Purchased in 2008.
Still painting......refuse to play until I'm done.....damn those small brushes :angry:

item.name: Blood Bowl: Team Manager ‚Äì The Card Game
item.comment:
This is multi-player Battle Line but with more information going on. It does a superb job of capturing the feel of Blood Bowl in a shorter, less fiddly package. The rules are actually surprisingly easy and the game flows nicely. I'd say it's a bit long for what it is.
I feel like 4 is best, followed by 3 and then 2. I'm not sure I'd bother with just 2, but I'm sure it would work well enough.

item.name: Blue Moon
item.comment: Excellent game that scratches my CCG itch. I rate this an 8 with only the base set, but I expect this to increase once I get some of the expansions.

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment:
Purchased 8/30/07 This is a really fun game. Works best for 3 or 4, but not too bad for 2. New players will have a hell of a time remembering what all the different cards do.
Sold in my game auction September 2009

item.name: Boggle
item.comment:
Boggle is a great word game that forces you to think outside the box and aim for tough words. It's very simple to play, but quite hard to play well.
Boggle requires people of relatively equal skill to be really enjoyable.
I'm not a huge word game fan, but I'll play this one occassionally.
Bought from WalMart or Target at some point.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment:
The right group = lots of laughs and fun. The wrong group = boring and tedious.
Be careful who you play this with.

item.name: Bolide
item.comment: I really enjoy this one. Its like one long math problem. This definately takes a while to get used to, but once players get the hang, it can move pretty quickly.

item.name: Bolide Tracks #1: Roma, Italian GP, and O Copo, Brazilian GP
item.comment: Nice to have some variation on the base set. These aren't necessary, but they do provide a good bit of challenge.

item.name: Bombay
item.comment:
Bombay is everything that a light, family-friendly pick-up and deliver game should be. The board and pieces are really nice to look at which pulls you in. The rules are easy to teach, yet offer some tough decisions. The game length is short enough for short attention spans.
This is a great game and I'm really glad I purchased it. My wife loves it so I think it will see a lot of action in our house.
Purchased from CSI March 17, 2011.
Sold in my Fall auction 2011.

item.name: Bonnie and Clyde
item.comment:
Purchased 3/5/09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Le Boomb!
item.comment:
Purchased from www.coolstuffinc.com on 12/30/09
I still own this, but it's just a single die and there is no game here at all.

item.name: Bootleggers
item.comment: Oh God, what a terribly boring game. No challenge and not much meaningful choice.

item.name: The Bottle Imp
item.comment:
I had always heard great things about this game but it left me flat. It wasn't very exciting and left me wanting to play other trick-taking games. I'd play it if someone else wanted to but I'd rather play Wizard, Trump Trick Game, Sticheln, or Die Sieben Siegel.
Purchased as the WBC August 7, 2010

item.name: Bottom of the 9th
item.comment: First two plays put this at 6.5. I do think it has room to climb. Need more plays to finalize my opinion.

item.name: Bowling Dice
item.comment: A no skill filler that's very simply bowling with dice. Not bad for a few bucks.

item.name: Bridge Troll
item.comment:
Not too bad. I like it well enough. It just seems that there are a lot of rules for what should be a simple light card game.
Purchased at 2009 WBC. Given to Luke and Brandy.

item.name: British Rails
item.comment:
I wanted a game that felt like I was really building something and I found it. Very simple rules yet the finances make it tough to play.
I've only played this one twice as a 2-player with my wife, but it works quite well that way.
Purchased 5/6/08

item.name: Bugs & Co
item.comment:
Speed Memory, but competitive and tough. Very simple but lots of fun.
Purchased at the Gauntlet 01/07/12.
Traded in the July Math Trade.

item.name: The Builders: Middle Ages
item.comment: This is a very simple little micro-game which would serve very well for new players. A fine way to kill some time. Light decisions and a bit of management combined with great graphics presents a solid overall package.

item.name: Burgen Land
item.comment:
Purchased 10/28/09
Sold in my game auction September 2009

item.name: Burger Joint
item.comment:
Purchased from Bouldergames.com on 9/21/09
Traded for Sole Mio!

item.name: Buy Low Sell High
item.comment:
This is a very stripped down stock-manipulation game. I'd say it's too stripped because its rather boring. Great idea, sad execution.
I expect more from Knizia.

item.name: BuyWord
item.comment:
I really didn't like BuyWord as it felt very random and luck based. If you get hit by more than one bad letter pull you'll lose. Also the game is very quick, almost too quick.
I thought this game had a great idea but was ruined by the luck aspect.

item.name: Cacao
item.comment:
Love the concepts, but far too light for me. And I like light games. This seemed like it wanted a bit more meat to tie in with the strategy.
Great game for families, I'm sure.

item.name: Caesar & Cleopatra
item.comment: A very interesting hand-management game form the Kosmos 2-player line. Some real tough choices and a lot of bluffing. It's quite a good spouse game.

item.name: California
item.comment:
Purchased 9/15/07
California is a family friendly tile laying game with a great mechanism to control costs. Players need to balance between taking money or taking tiles. Most scores end up being pretty close.
I've played the game with 3, 4, or 5 and it works equally well at all numbers. 3 or 4 is probably best, but I'll play this game with any number of players.

item.name: Call of Cthulhu: Collectible Card Game
item.comment: I played the CCG before it became an LCG. I do love all the different strength symbols on the cards as I feel it makes the game more multi-dimensional. There's a lot text on these cards which can be a bit intimidating but overall it's fairly simple. I love the domains instead of mana in Magic because it means you'll never be left without resources.

item.name: Camel Up
item.comment:
This is pretty much a perfect gateway game or one to break out with families. Very simple rules, quick play time, and lots of wackiness to keep it fun. You'd be amazed how quickly your "sure thing" bet goes bust.
Also, it's a beautiful presentation. Sure to please the folks sitting around the table.
I love it.

item.name: Campaign Manager 2008
item.comment:
Purchased from www.bouldergames.com on 1/28/10
First play with basic setup was great at first, but then got a bit boring. Hoping the second game goes better.
The second play did not get any better. This game is a boring exercise in repetition which requires almost no critical thinking or decision making. I'd play it if requested, but I really wouldn't want to.
I traded this off in March 2010.
And then I re-acquired it on 2/17/2011 from GameSurplus.com.
I've been playing on Yucata.de and I can't remember why I disliked it so much early on. It's awesome. Now, to get more F2F games in with my wife!
I like this one a lot, but the wife doesn't. Traded away in March 2011.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: This is a perfect example of a dice-rolling push-your-luck game. It's been around for a long time and is still the best at what it does.

item.name: Canasta
item.comment: Not a big fan of this one. It's basically Rummy with a whole lot more annoying rules and partners play. It's a fine way to pass some time and I'll play if folks want, but I'm not really interested.

item.name: The Candy Bar Game
item.comment:
We played a very different version of the Candy Bar Game, but it was absolutely the best party game I've ever played. This is one game that will remain fun every time we play it. I can't wait to play it again.
Yes, I'm 100% serious about this rating.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment:
As of 10/06/07, this is still my favorite game and the only one I rate a 10. Its just perfect, IMHO.
EDIT - As of February 13, 2008, I have another 10. But this is still my all-time favorite.
EDIT - As of March 8, 2008, Carc has been replaced as my favorite game by Scripts and Scribes. Its been a great run, but S&S just offers deeper gameplay with less luck.
EDIT - On July 14, 2010, the unthinkable happened. I dropped Carc down to a 9. I still thinks it's brilliant, but I really have no desire to play it anymore.
Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Carcassonne: 10 Year Special Edition
item.comment:
Carcassonne remains the perfect game for me. I rate the original a 10 and I'll rate this one the same way. The new edition is even more beautiful with the really cool box and the translucent meeples. Totally awesome.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com on 6/7/2011

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 1 ‚Äì Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment:
Many people say this is mandatory to Carc because it increases scoring options and prevents a lot of blocking. I like the Inns, but I don't like it eliminating blocking. However, I'd still recommend Carc fans gets this as it does open up the game. Not better, just more variety.
Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers
item.comment: I rate basic Carcassonne a 10 and this one a 4. Why? Because it takes away the beautiful simplicity of Carcassonne and adds in many rules. I don't think they enhance the game at all but rather add unneeded options to a game that was pure genius. H&G isn't terrible. I'd play it if requested. But I'd choose regular Carc every single time if given the chance.

item.name: Carcassonne: South Seas
item.comment:
I'm starting this as an 8, but it may go up. Boy does this shake up Carc! I really liked it and felt it was a very different game. I do like that you can take back meeples if you want/need to. I think this game rewards much more short-term scoring so it's a lot more tactical than the base game, but time will tell if that's accurate.
It's definitely different enough to justify owning both this and the base game.
Not sure I'd use this to teach new players though. I think the collecting wares is tougher to manage than just getting points. The fishermen are easier to teach than farmers, but otherwise it's a bit more obtuse. Still, a great addition to the Carc family. I'm looking forward to more of these in the series.

item.name: Carcassonne: Star Wars
item.comment: My favorite game of all time with Star Wars theme and new rules? Perfect. The dice rolling is random, but this is just so much fun.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: A 2-player specific Carc variant by Reiner Knizia. I like the wall surrounding the playing area and I also like the bonus chips. I don't like how the builidngs are played next to each other Its an okay game, but I'd rather play the base game with 2. It just works better.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Dice Game
item.comment:
A purely luck based dice game. Good enough to kill some time, but probably only about 5 minutes of time as it's not hard to get 42 points, especially if you're able to get a doubling bonus.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com on 6/7/2011
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Mini Expansion
item.comment: Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Carcassonne: The Princess & the Dragon
item.comment: Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune
item.comment:
This is a decent take on Carc. The Wheel is a bit silly, but you don't have to use it to play.
If you like Carc and want something different, go for it. If you don't like Carc you'll probably like it even less.

item.name: Carcassonne: Winter Edition
item.comment: It's Carc, so it's perfect. I do like the Gingerbread Man expansion quite a bit. The changes to the base set create more scoring opportunities so expect scores to be a bit higher.

item.name: Cardcassonne
item.comment:
Purchased from www.coolstuffinc.com on 12/30/09
Cardcassonne is an interesting press-your-luck style card game with a bit of bluffing mixed in. The rules are quite simple and player choice is what drives the game.
I wish they hadn't labeled this with the Carc brand as it has nothing to do with it's namesake.

item.name: Cards Against Humanity
item.comment:
Imagine if Apples to Apples was really inappropriate. That's Cards Against Humanity. It's certainly fun for about 20 minutes, just like A2A. However, the level of depravity is much higher here.
A winning phrase from my game on 8/2:
"Maybe she's born with it, maybe its...." RACISM.

item.name: Carson City
item.comment:
Carson City is a terrific take on worker-placement games. The innovative mechanism of the duels is really quite awesome and adds a lot of unpredictability to a normally predictable situation.
The game works surprisingly well as a 2-player hence the rating of 7. I strongly suspect this one to go up when I finally get to play it with multiple players.
Christmas in July 2010 present from KSensei

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment:
Cartagena is one of the best family/gateway/light games I've ever played. The rules are easy and there are good decisions to make. The playtime is relatively short as well.
You want more challenge? Try the advanced rules. Ouch, my brain!

item.name: Cartagena 2. The Pirate's Nest
item.comment: Sold in my game auction September 2009

item.name: Castaways of Deadmans Bay
item.comment: A clever 2-player tug-o-war style game with multiple paths to victory. The double-think makes this one a lot of fun. Not terribly deep but a nice diversion for 2 pirates.

item.name: The Castle of the Devil
item.comment:
A decent little game of deducing who your teammates are by attacking them. Once you know your team, you try to meet your team's win condition.
Oh wait...this sounds just like Shadow Hunters. Plays Shadow Hunters instead.

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment:
Holy Vanilla, Batman! This is the most vanilla and themeless game I've ever played. It's a fine game, but the "theme" is more tacked on than anything I've ever played. It's a really ugly presentation.
Otherwise, it's a fine little co-op that's tense and seems really tough to win. I'd play it again, but I'd rather play a co-op with some theme like Yggdrasil, Pandemic, or Defenders of the Realm.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment:
A very clever dice game with tons and tons of options. Unfortunately, the huge amounts of options become a bit overwhelming at the end of the game and things slow down quite a bit.
Another winner from Feld, the king of all things Alea.

item.name: Castles of Mad King Ludwig
item.comment:
This is exactly my kind of game. I love when I get to build my house/castle. It feels like the descendant of California. Pricing the rooms so other people will buy them is really the key, but don't make them too cheap!
LOVE.

item.name: Catan
item.comment:
Purchased 4/3/08
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Catan Dice Game
item.comment: A decent little filler. Not much choice, but it does allow you to build and advance your society so it's a bit of fun. Don't expect this to actually replace Settlers even as a filler.

item.name: Cauldron
item.comment: First two plays were with 2. I'm looking forward to playing with more. I think this will be a lot of fun.

item.name: Caylus Magna Carta
item.comment: Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: The Challenge
item.comment:
The Challenge is a fun little game of beating each other up. The rules are very simple. The production quality is terrible. Wow, there's really not much to say about this one.
This is definitely an inspiration for Cutthroat Caverns. The last person to inflict the killing damage gets the points for the kill. That's right there in CC. Not a knock, but it was fun to play a game that seemed to be a partial inspiration.

item.name: Charioteer
item.comment:
Wow, what a difference a few rule tweaks can make! I rated the prototype I played a 5 because it wasn't quite tight enough and some cards were overpowered. However, the final product gets a 7.5 from me. Great game with some very cool choices. I like how several interesting mechanisms are tied together to make one strong game. The theme actually works very well too.
ORIGINAL COMMENT
This is only rated a 5 because its a prototype. This will probably increase dramatically, but there's no way to know for sure. I always rate games once I play them, so this one gets a rank even though its not quite completed.
EDIT**********************
Removed my rating of the prototype now that the new version is available. Will re-rate after playing the new game.

item.name: Ch√¢teau Roquefort
item.comment:
Chateau Roquefort has one of the coolest boards I've ever seen. I love the hidden information/memory aspect of the game as well. This is one situation where action points work perfectly.
This one works great for kids but is actually quite fun for adults too.
I'm more impressed by this game than I am of most new Euros. It's too bad this kind of innovation was used for a kids game.

item.name: Checkers
item.comment: I own this, but I'm not adding it to my collection.

item.name: Cherokee
item.comment: A really interesting card game in which you have a hidden team and try to jockey for position in the tribal hierarchy. Great domino mechanic makes you try to think ahead to chain your cards together properly. Great choices in a super easy design.

item.name: Chess
item.comment:
Everyone should at least know how to play Chess even if they are not proficient at it. This is the most classic of games and deserves a lot of respect.
I own this, but I'm not adding it to my collection.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment:
I bought this game when it was Wabash Cannonball and then upgraded to Chicago Express. This game is all about forming, then smashing, then reforming alliances. The teams shift constantly and you need to stay on top of it. Every dollar counts in this one.
Traded away in the Labor of Love Math Trade.

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment: I think this is actually better than Chicago Express. There's only a slight rules difference, but I actually think the spartan graphics make the game easier to play. Either way, you can't go wrong as the game system is incredibly good.

item.name: Chocolatl
item.comment:
Another great light-medium design from Gunther Burkhardt. This game couldn't be much simpler in design and yet it evokes a lot of decisions. There's so much balance to consider that what should be simple choice turns into brain-burning agony. A big part of the game is playing the tie-breakers which adds a great layer to the decision tree. It's so delightful that I can't wait to play it again.
It's a 7.5 for now, but I think once I get more plays it will go up to an 8 or 8.5. Not truly great, but really quite good.
Sadly, I traded this one away in the Labor of Love Math Trade.
Christmas present 2010 from my MIL.

item.name: Chronology
item.comment: More of a history lesson than a game, this is a neat way to learn something and pass some time.

item.name: Circus Train (First Edition)
item.comment:
This is a great hand management/resource management game for 2 players. It's really tough to manage your resources and make everything work as you race across the country to get what you want.
I think this one may increase greatly with repeated plays.
Purchased as the WBC August 7, 2010

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: A decent role selection game. I like a lot of the double-guessing that goes on, but I don't like how the game practically refuses to end. It's a lot of fun up until someone gets close to winning. Then it becomes "beat on the leader". Reminds me of a Steve Jackson game in that regard.

item.name: Cities
item.comment:
I'd really like to try this game but its just too expensive.
**********EDIT**********
I was gifted this game by my friend Steve K during our visit to England. My wife loved this game in about 5 minutes and instantly said I could buy it. Just a few minutes later, my good friend gave us his copy.
This is a great puzzle game which is best at the more advanced levels. Incredibly difficult to play well because you have to plan for the unplannable and try to remain flexible.
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: Claustrophobia
item.comment: A pretty cool 2-player assymetrical game. I love the use of dice. I just don't like scenario based games much. This is probably the best of the bunch.

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.comment:
A tolerable game that reminds me of the set-collecting found in Ticket to Ride. It's a very easy game to play and teach. I do love how the corruption points make you consider your choices a bit more.
This game is the very definition of "over-produced". There's so many components that don't do anything for the game besides make it look like a toy.

item.name: Cloud 9
item.comment: This is a solid push-your-luck game that unfortunately lasts far too long. I like the way the dice produce a lot of unpredictability, but this one outstays its welcome. Play Incan Gold instead.

item.name: Clue
item.comment:
I have an English version called Cluedo. Crazy English people.
It's amazing how much fun this was as a kid. Now I can't even be bothered to play it.

item.name: Clue Mysteries
item.comment: Clue Mysteries was fun for one play, and then we realized that it is for kids. As a kids game it's probably quite enjoyable. For adults, much less.

item.name: Cockroach Poker
item.comment: A nice light bluffing game. It's a lot more fun than you'd think possible with just simple cards.

item.name: Cockroach Salad
item.comment: This game is confusing and difficult to play, but not in the rewarding way. Unfortunately, Craperjunglefaker is no fun and not stimulating in any sort of way. Play Halli Galli or Jungle Speed instead.

item.name: Code 777
item.comment:
I love the idea here, but my God is this game difficult. Maybe I just can't figure out the right way to use the clues, but this one seems hard. Still, it's a great idea and we will certainly play it more.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com on 9/21/10
Traded away in March 2011.

item.name: Code Omega
item.comment:
Ever since we first played Ubongo, I've had my eye on this game. Our first play proved that my I was right. Code Omega is a great puzzle game that is a bit odd in the scoring. I think Ubongo does scoring better, but this game is great in it's own right.
If you like Ubongo or other puzzle games, this is one you need to try.
Acquired in a trade that ran over between Feb and March 2011. Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: Cold War: CIA vs KGB
item.comment:
Edit 4/8/12 - I don't know what I was thinking the first time I played this way back when. This is a pretty awesome game. Actually, you've got lots of mini games rolled into one. I love the card interaction but wished there was more carry-over from round to round. Winning certain countries should mean something more. Still, it's pretty good, but not truly great. Definitely worth $12 at the new price point. DEFINITELY.
Very few actual choices for the players to make. This is mostly a game of random chance and luck. I find it utterly boring with no real sense of accomplishment when you do something good.

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment:
Coloretto should have been more fun, but it felt like it lacked tension that other similar games have. It's a simple game that may work as an intro game or a quick filler, but it leaves me quite unfulfilled.
########### Edit! What a great little filler. Quick, fun, and easy to teach with some fun decisions. This is one of my bee favorite fillers.

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment:
An interesting game which almost feels like a trick-taking game. Going last is incredibly powerful in this game.
I like the variety of cards and how things constantly get messed up. There's a lot of chaos when you play with 5 or 6 but it makes the game a lot of fun.

item.name: Confusion: Espionage and Deception in the Cold War
item.comment:
This game is so simple it's amazing. Take on part deduction (similar to Guess Who?) and one part Stratego, mix them up with a dash of screwage (Double Agent!) and you get Confusion, a superb game for 2 players.
The rules are incredibly easy to grasp. The game itself, is quite another. There's games within the game and that makes this one really unique.
The components = pure awesome.
Stronghold is firmly establishing itself as a big-time player in the boardgame market.
My wife would rate this a 10 for sure.
Purchased from Stronghold Games on 07/08/2011

item.name: Container
item.comment:
This is a 3 to me because I don't like the game. It feels a lot like work and really isn't much fun in my opinion. I think the game breaks when someone decides to play the cheap game because everyone else either does the same or doesn't sell anything.
That said, I appreciate a lot of what this game does. It's pretty neat how you have to go around in circles to get the goods you want. That's certainly innovative.
Ultimately, I won't play this again. I really despised it.

item.name: Continental Express
item.comment:
I opened the rules and thought "This is going to suck." Alas, it did not! Its the perfect length for what it is. 10 more minutes and I would have been bored.
Simple rules with an emphasis on manipulating cards. Nice artwork, too.
A great gateway game.

item.name: Core Worlds
item.comment:
It's early, but I'm rating this one a 9 based on my 2 plays and one GM of the game. This is a deckbuilder but more importantly, it's a game of arching strategy that has players making constant decisions. You never stop making decisions in Core Worlds which is why I love it. You have to carefully balance the timing of your actions along with your resources.
Lots of tension. Lots of decisions.
This game is a winner.
The final product is superb. The artwork and design is fantastic as is the quality of the cards. I'm a big fan.
The shine really wore off quick. It's just lacking something to make it awesome. Not sure what, but probably more player interaction.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics 1/14/12.

item.name: Corps Command: Totensonntag
item.comment: A very simple wargame that could likely work as an intro to more complex stuff. The biggestthing for me is that I just don't like hex-and-counter wargames.

item.name: Cosmic Cows
item.comment:
Once upon a time, when I was new to this wonderful hobby, this was a favorite of my wife and I. Now, after going much deeper in the rabbit hole, I wonder how we could have ever liked this? There's no choices to make and the game will eventually devolve into waiting for someone to get continuously good or bad rolls. That is not fun.
I suppose as a kids game it's not horrendous, but I won't be playing this one again.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment:
Finally got to play this classic. I like it because its really fun and unpredictable. I love the destiny mechanic because it means the person you just allied with may suddenly become your foe. Good stuff and quite entertaining. Probably best with the full 5.
A gift from Father Greg, March 2011.
Traded away in my Short and Sweet Math Trade.

item.name: Court of the Medici
item.comment: Purchased 4/27/09 Traded to Dave Kahnt with some other stuff for Robo Rally. 9/7/09

item.name: Cover Up
item.comment: Three dimensional Connect 4. It's a pretty good little game, albeit a bit boring. I'd gladly play if asked, but not worth owning for me.

item.name: Cowabunga
item.comment:
Cowabunga is a nice mix of memory and hand management. There's a lot of luck in the game, especially as you increase player count. With 3 or 4, this game is a lot of fun. It really couldn't be easier to teach or play and games only last 15-20 minutes. Folks who don't like memory aspects in their games may not be interested.
For anyone that is looking for a fun game to play with kids old enough for some math, this is a great choice.
Purchased 11/15/07

item.name: Cribbage
item.comment: Why do people like this? No decisions and heavily luck based. I'll play almost any 2-player before I try this again.

item.name: Crocodile Pool Party
item.comment: I've played much worse games. CPP is quite pedestrian in it's approach. I think it's a solid foundation for a game, but it needs more to be worth playing.

item.name: Crows
item.comment:
A fine tile-laying game, but a bit too simple. It feels like luck is the biggest factor here. I just don't see a way to play well unless you get lucky.
I like how the crows gather and then separate. That's a great way to keep the crow piles from getting too large.
Received in the WBC math trade August 5th.
Given to my buddy as a gift.

item.name: Cthulhu Dice
item.comment:
The Great Old One will not be pleased if he plays this. Steve Jackson, I suggest you try to find a place to hide before he arrives.
Purchased from my FLGS

item.name: Cthulhu Gloom
item.comment: This game gets points for the novelty factor of the amazing clear cards. The new Cthulhu version of the game is cooler, just because of the mythos. Otherwise, it's the same as Gloom which a super-light game that's more about making up a story than actually playing.

item.name: Cthulhu Rising
item.comment:
Purchased from www.bouldergames.com on 1/28/10
This game catches a lot of flack for having a tacked on theme. That much is undeniable. However, this is a fun little 2-player game that requires some thinking, especially as the game draws to a close. It's not the best game ever, but it's totally worth the $7 I spent on it.

item.name: The Current Number of the Beast
Cutthroat Caverns
item.comment:
Purchased from Curt @ Smirk & Dagger on 7/9/11 at DexCon.
Finally got to play this game and it's a lot of fun. Very simple rules with some wonky timing issues. It doesn't see to have quite as much back-stabbing as I had hopped, but there's just enough to make it interesting.
Traded in May 2012 Math trade.

item.name: Dancing Dice
item.comment: Just another dice game. I'll take Ra Dice or Roll Through the Ages any time instead. Not bad, but not great.

item.name: Darjeeling
item.comment:
Purchased 1/23/08
Sold in my game auction September 2009

item.name: Dawn of the Zeds (first edition)
item.comment: I'm not sure I love this. It feels like a lot of work.

item.name: Deadwood
item.comment:
I played a bunch of rules wrong in my first play through so I'm expecting this rating to climb much higher. I loved an awful lot about this game. Tons of interaction. I'll formulate a more proper response after I get to play it the right way.
Purchased from Target 04/18/2012

item.name: Defenders of the Realm
item.comment:
This game is to Pandemic what A Few Acres of Snow is to Dominion. It takes a great engine and uses it to make an even better game. My first play was a lot of fun and only took about an hour plus some time for rules explanations and lookups.
A solid co-op experience that offers much more game than Pandemic.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com 9/20/11.

item.name: Dexter: The Board Game
item.comment:
The game captures the Dexter universe quite nicely. It's quite thematic, especially with the mini garbage bags.
The downside here is that this is a roll and move game. I'm positive that this game could be made tremendously better by adding in an action point system using cards instead. I may work on this because I love everything else about the game.
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: Diamonds Club
item.comment:
Purchased 2/13/09 I really like this game, but I'm concerned about the balance. The Tree strategy seems unbeatable. I'm not sure I can stand that.
EDIT***********************************
It appears that the only way to really prevent the tree player from winning the game is to rush the end of the game. That's completely ludicrous from my viewpoint. I really dislike games where controlling the end is such a massive component of playing. I'll pass on this one. Any interest in trading or buying, please Geekmail me.
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Dice Town
item.comment: Purchased 4/20/09

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
I used to rate Dominion an 8, but I've been forced to drop that because the game now bores me to tears. There is almost nothing to do when it's not your turn unless there are a lot of attacks in play. When those are in play, they make the game unnecessarily long. Add that up and it just ruins the game for me. Don't even get me started on curses. It's just too long for what it is.
BGG Secret Santa 2008

item.name: Dominion: Alchemy
item.comment: Purchased from my LGS, Mighty Titan Hobbies and Games in May 2010.

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: Purchased from Game Surplus 8/14/09

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment:
Purchased from Coolstuffinc.com on 10/28/09
More of the same, but an interesting group of new cards. I've not played enough to really dig in, but I like what I'm seeing so far. Treasure Chest is rediculous if you can pull it off. Makes for a very fast game.

item.name: Don Quixote
item.comment: A wonderful bingo-like game with a bit of luck and planning. Things rarely go the way you'd like so you need to do your best with what you get. Nice bits and easy rules.

item.name: Double or Nothing
item.comment: Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Dracula
item.comment:
A very light memory/action-point game. It felt very dry and boring and didn't have much to do with the theme. It also had a race mechanic as you moved around the board trying to find your stuff without dying before the other guy finds his stuff.
It's okay, but nothing spectacular.

item.name: Dragon's Gold
item.comment: A simple negotiation game. I don't remember much else about it other than it was okay, but not spectacular.

item.name: Dragonheart
item.comment: My first play was interesting. I think this is a game of major hand management in which being crafty helps as well. I like how multiple cards can take different piles.

item.name: Drako
item.comment:
A really nice asymmetrical game for 2 players. I like the hand management and timing aspects of this game. There's a lot of cat and mouse, but since the board is small there's only so far to run.
Nice bits and very streamlined rules. This is a good 2-player game, but not a great one.

item.name: Drakon (third edition)
item.comment:
This game feels like it should be Ameritrash because there's some nice screwage going on, but it feels very optimizational in gameplay because you're really trying to set yourself up for a chain of gold coins. It's fun and simple and a game that I'll definitely play if asked. Very different from pretty much everything I've ever played.
This deserves a reprint.

item.name: Dream Factory
item.comment:
Originally Purchased 8/8/07. Sold off and re-acquired in a trade.
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Dreamblade
item.comment: What a great game! Dreamblade is like bizarro-chess. Unfortunately, there are so many rules printed on the BOTTOM of the figures that it gets to be a pain. Perhaps if you play a lot you could memorize or even make cheat sheets. Still, way too many rules.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Tomb of the Lich Lord
item.comment: Have only played solo thus far. Rating might increase a bit once I get to play with some other people.

item.name: DungeonQuest (third edition)
item.comment:
This game is actively trying to kill you. It's truly out for blood. In my first play, I died on the first turn in the Bottomless Pit. Right then and there, I was in love. I can't wait to play this more!
Received in a Math Trade on 5/4/12.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment:
I'll rate this a 9 for now, but I can see this going to a 10. It's perfect. Simple rules, quick playtime, great components. If you want a dungeon crawler hack-n-slash game that plays in an hour, you simply cannot do any better.
This is the real deal.
Purchased from Buy.com on 9/21/10

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Wrath of Ashardalon Board Game
item.comment:
I have to rate this one just a bit lower than Castle Ravenloft because it's about 25% harder. It's so tough, its almost discouraging.
Still, it's a whole lot of awesome in one box.
Purchased from jerkules 04/02/2011
Sold in game auction May 2011.

item.name: DVONN
item.comment: Look out TAMSK, I've got a new favorite GIPF game. DVONN is brilliant. Incredibly simple rules, but really tough.

item.name: The Dwarf King
item.comment: A nice trick taker with variable rules. A bit chaotic but still good fun.

item.name: Easter Island
item.comment: A very boring and dry 2-player abstract. I was disappointed in this one as they took a cool idea but forgot to include any fun in the game.

item.name: Eat Poop You Cat
item.comment: I rate this game a 5 because its fun to play once in a while, but I wouldn't want to play multiple games in one sitting because it really would get boring. Also, there's no real game here, so I can't rate it very highly. Still, this is rediculously fun.

item.name: Eaten by Zombies!
item.comment:
This game isn't very much fun. Clunky, not engaging, and just plain uncooked.
Purchased from Boards & Bits 10/25/2011
Given away on 11/4/11. Good luck!

item.name: Eggs and Empires
item.comment: A wonderful simultaneous blind-bidding game that plays in 30 minutes with the full 6. Perfect for lunctime gaming.

item.name: Egizia
item.comment:
I love this game online where I rate it a solid 10. But face to face it feels incredibly fiddly so it gets a lower rating. I still think this is an almost perfect version of worker-placement. Best of all, it works awesome for 2-players which not many worker-placement games do.
Purchased from GameSurplus.com in August 2010.

item.name: Einauge sei wachsam!
item.comment:
I think this is a great game. But I'm not quite sure. I'd like to play it in person before making full judgement, but I'm leaning towards the positive side on this one.
The 2-player game is fast! But I think it may lack some tightness which makes it less than stellar to play that way. I think it's best with 4 probably although 3 and 5 seem fine too.
I think I have this game rated perfectly. I'm not in love with it, but I don't mind playing it. Could be a LOT worse.

item.name: Einfach Genial Knobelspass
item.comment: This is not a game, it's a collection of Ingenious based puzzles. Maybe worth solving through one time, but that's about it.

item.name: Elder Sign
item.comment:
TONS of dice rolling. I love the theme and I like the mechanics, but this game felt impossible to me. I need to play this more.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics on 9/17/11.

item.name: Elder Sign: Unseen Forces
item.comment: Definitely adds a lot more good stuff to Elder Sign. If you like ES, this is a must.

item.name: Eldritch Horror
item.comment:
A VERY streamlined Arkham Horror. I love how much less fiddly this game is and to me, it packs the same amount of theme and atmosphere.
My first game wasn't great. It was good. However, I'm thinking this will have a lot to do with the Mythos deck and since it varies from game to game, you'll have home runs and strike-outs. I'm okay with that and am looking forward to my next playthrough.

item.name: Elk Fest
item.comment:
A fun 2-player flicky game that is way overpriced for what you get in the box. I like this one and may have to make my own copy.
I supported my FLGS and bought a copy in April 2011.
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment: I'm not sure how good this game is. I enjoyed my first play quite a bit, but I feel like this game needs an expansion out of the box to add some variety. It's a bit samey. That said, I enjoy the concept and I like the way the game works. It's a simplified Race for the Galaxy with some Glory to Rome mixed in.

item.name: Enemy Chocolatier
item.comment: A great game in a Cheapass package. I think this one is quite good. Everyone has similar yet seperate goals that often conflict with each other. Money is tight and its not unusual for someone to sneak out a Special Recipe victory while everyone else fights for normal victory points.

item.name: Epic Trading Card Game
item.comment:
Purchased at FLGS - early 09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Eurorails
item.comment: I like British Rails better because the board is smaller, but this is relatively the same game. Both are fun, but I only need one.

item.name: Evo
item.comment: Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Evolution
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Excape
item.comment:
This is a great dice game that combines the thrill of dice-rolling with a great push-your-luck bidding system. There's a lot of "take that!" thrown in but the game is light, fast, and quick so it shouldn't upset anyone. It plays up to 6 which is awesome. Highly recommended for a family game.
Another winner from Dr. Knizia.
Purchased from Game Surplus 2/25/2011
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Factory Fun
item.comment: There's not much fun in the factory as far as I'm concerned.

item.name: Fairy Tale
item.comment:
Fairy Tale scratches a big CCG-related itch for me. I've always been a huge fan of draft formats and I think Fairy Tale does it better than any other game I've played yet. Sure, 7 Wonders plays more people, but Fairy Tale beats it for a lot of reasons including portability, space required to play, and 2-player quality.
Purchased at FLGS in late 2007

item.name: Famiglia
item.comment:
Purchased from CSI 12/2010
Played once and it felt really boring. Maybe it's because it was tough to get started, but it wasn't fun. It felt like way too much luck as well. I don't know, it just didn't do it for me.
If someone ever offers to teach, I'd try again. Maybe I'm wrong.
Traded away in a Math Trade - February 2011

item.name: Favor of the Pharaoh
item.comment: To Court the King was a great game. This is that game made better in every way.

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment:
Wallace has successfully taken the Dominion engine and made it into an actual game. The mechanics of this game are fantastic to be sure. I find a lot of flaw in the following ideas:
1. There are certain cards that either side MUST buy. This makes the game feel sort of scripted.
2. There's not a lot of conflict.
3. This is a Euro-game, not a war game.
4. At heart, this is a simple optimization game.
I think this is a fine game and I like it well enough. I don't think this is as good as the majority of people do. It's fine and I'd play it again, but it's not amazing.

item.name: Field Commander: Rommel
item.comment:
A great WW2 solitaire game. The rules are straight-forward and the game plays very well. Low counter density makes this quite manageable.
The missions are ridiculously tough though. You will certainly not beat this and be done anytime soon.

item.name: Filipino Fruit Market
item.comment:
Rating is for Tindahan. Seemed unnecessarily complicated to me. The Fruit Stand cards are practically useless. Why the hell didn't they make the things color coded? It would have been so much easier. Perhaps this is where most of my animosity towards the game comes from.
Bastos looks better, but I don't know that I'll get the chance to play it.
Purchased from CSI late March 2010

item.name: Finca
item.comment:
A decent enough game. Light with a focus on timing. Decisions are fairly straight-forward. Probably a good family game, but I have a lot of those already so this one will not be joining my collection. Still, I'd play it if asked, but I'm in no hurry to own it.
************EDIT********************
Forget what I said above! This game is great. Very simple rules, quick gameplay, and great use of a rondel. Sure, the decisions may not be the toughest, but they are there. The blind tile flip adds a bit of press-your-luck to the game as well.
This is a perfect family game that should have won the SdJ.
************EDIT********************
I've upped this from an 8 to a 9. For such a simple game, there's a lot to consider. What a perfect example of a medium-light Euro. How did this game not win the SdJ?
************EDIT********************
One more edit. I'm not going to adjust the rating, but I really don't recommend this with 4. Its incredibly chaotic and you can't plan for anything. I'll play it with 4, but I don't really enjoy it. It's just too crazy. That's probably why it didn't win the SdJ.

item.name: Finca: El Razul
item.comment:
Some people will love this expansion, but not me. I think it's great for playing really casually because it really increases the flexibility. However, I love to play Finca really hardcore so I'll leave this one out.
One of the best parts is that you can add bits of the expansion as you like so if there are parts that don't float your boat you can just leave them out.
Purchased Spielbox magazine from www.boardsandbits.com late 2010
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: A Fistful of Dinero
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: A Fistful of Penguins
item.comment:
This is a fun little game although it's really quite rulesy for such a short game. Once you learn it, it's actually a fun little press-your-luck game that's pleasant enough.
Definitely not one I need, but a fun design anyway. I'd play if asked.

item.name: FITS
item.comment:
Purchased 5/12/09
This game is perfect in every way. Fun, easy to teach, and infinitely replayable. Sure, it may get a bit samey once you've played the heck out of it, but it's always challenging and a lot of fun. A brilliant design by Reiner Knizia that is so simple kids can play it yet challenging enough to torture adults.

item.name: Five Tribes
item.comment: All hail the king of Analysis Paralysis!

item.name: Fjords
item.comment: Purchased 4/9/08

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue
item.comment:
Our first play was on playtest copy so I can't comment about components. What I can say is that this is a really fun co-op that has some great new ideas.
The fire movement is just awesome. I love the randomness of the dice rolls and then how the fire reacts. It's really neat and adds a lot of tension to the game.
I'm hoping they clear up some of the mechanics that we don't like. If they do, this could be an 8.

item.name: Flip City
item.comment: We tried to play this once and found it both confusing and tedious for something that's supposed to be fast and fun. I really didn't like the double-sided cards. I'm in the minority on this one for sure.

item.name: Flowerpower
item.comment:
Homemade copy made in summer of 08.
I own a sweet homemade copy. Now that I've spent the time and money to make this game, I can guarantee you they reprint it. :angry:

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: The most random game ever. No way to know what will happen. A game may take 30 seconds or an hour. You never know! Unfortunately, that kind of randomness comes at the price of fun. It's worth a play or two or even the occassional game, but not much else.

item.name: Food Fight
item.comment:
A sort of multiplayer Battle Line mixed with drafting. Players draft cards to battle at 1-3 locations. Your army is created from what you draft and then shuffled. In my opinion, this is where the game loses its luster. When you randomize the army, you lose all semblance of control.
It's a fine game and I'd play it again, but it could be better.
DO NOT play this without drafting. It's quite pointless that way.

item.name: Football Strategy
item.comment: A decent game of guessing your opponents plays and then coming up with a resolution from a chart. It's a bit dry, but it works pretty well. The game has certainly held up over time. It may not be exciting for non-football fans, but it does a nice job of simulating a game.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment:
One of the greatest fillers of all time and a wonderful gateway game. The simplicity of the design is matched by the tough choices you have to make. The length is ideal and the game scales perfectly from 3-6 although 4 is probably the sweet spot. Easy rules make this is snap to teach.
Purchased from Ladislaus - 2007

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment:
This is a streamlined version of Pandemic that is simpler, faster, and more fun to play. The fiddliness of Pandemic has been removed and the game has been distilled down to its essence which, in my opinion, is a beautiful thing.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com in June 2010.

item.name: Four Taverns
item.comment: This felt like an easier version of Smash Up. Need more plays to confirm.

item.name: Freight Train
item.comment:
Move this pile of rocks to that pile of rocks. Add some rocks, and repeat ad nauseum.
Skip this unless organizing filing cabinets is your idea of a good way to spend an hour.

item.name: Fresco
item.comment:
I'm rating this one at 8.5 for the 4-player game. It's full of delicious decisions, most of which revolve around the "wake up time" mechanism. There's a lot to like here. Fairly easy to teach and play, yet full of decisions.
The rating of 2 is for the 2-player game which is just no fun. I hate dummy players in games and this may actually be worse. I'm sure my rating will increase with more players so I will adjust it accordingly.
Purchased from CSI late March 2010
Sold in my game auction July 2011

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment:
Do you enjoy building something and then watching it get devastated? If so, this may be your game. It's actually a fun speed game for the first half and then a maddening game of watching your shabby ship navigate the perils of space. Great components
Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: A Game of Thrones (first edition)
item.comment:
It hurts me to give this such a low rating, but I have too for several reasons.
1. The game is long. You're talking at least 4 hours. 2. It feels like you're just grinding trying to get a tiny advantage. Combined with #1, this turn to being tedious very quickly. 3. Too much room for AP. The game needs a 10 minute timer on placing your activations. 4. Combat sucks. Really quite boring. 5. Not enough space in some of the regions for pieces.
I love the books so I enjoy the idea of this game but I just don't like it in practive. I'm happy to have played it, but I probably never will again unless I can convince everyone to play with a timer.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
item.comment:
I've only dabbled in this game so far, but I like what I see. I love how there's different ways to attack and so many different ways to go about altering strategies. I think this game is really going to work for me and I'm excited to see it happen. It's a 6.5 for now, but I think this one has tons of potential.
An end of tax season present from my wife, April 23, 2011.
Sold in my WBC aution 7/11

item.name: Garibaldi: The Escape
item.comment:
This game was so boring it left me angry. I was not pleased with this one. There's just nothing to it besides the hidden movement.
Skip this one.

item.name: Gears of War: The Board Game
item.comment: I completely see why so many people like this. I don't think it's for me. A bit too intense and crazy. If you like shooter video games, this one will work perfectly. I'm not in that camp at all.

item.name: Genji
item.comment: Such a terrible game. There's a great idea here and I do like the theme and the ideas. Unfortunately, there's almost no choices that matter and the components are not good. This is a missed opportunity.

item.name: German Railways
item.comment: This game is 90% Chicago Express with a new and often infuriating turn mechanism along with special abilities for the train companies. It's mechanically fine, but that turn order track really rubs me the wrong way. I'd rather play Chicago Express.

item.name: Ghosts!
item.comment: This was a very simple Stratego-like game of hidden movement and bluffing. It's a great game for kids, and while some people would say the same for adults, I disagree. It's too simple for adults to enjoy.

item.name: Giganten
item.comment:
It took a long time, but I finally got a copy of my grail game and it's in great condition. I can't wait to play this with my family. I think they will really dig it.
Acquired in a trade May 2010

item.name: Give Me the Brain!
item.comment:
A very simple card game that's most fun if you get into the theme by reading the cards in zombie voices. There's really no strategy and not much in the way of actual gameplay. It's a very simple game that plays quick. I'll probably suggest this as a very light starter or filler.
