Purchased at Time Warp Comics on 4/22/12

item.name: Glen More
item.comment:
Brilliant game that takes my love of tile-laying to a much higher level. The choices are interesting and everything is important. Multiple paths to victory and a lot of balance make this game shine. What is really fantastic is the turn mechanism which means the player in back may get lots of extra turns.
I'm very pleased with this game.
German copy acquired from Boards & Bits 6/10/09
*********EDIT**********
I've upped my rating to a 9. Brilliant game with numerous ways to win. My last game had 3 of us doing things completely different and it came out incredibly close. Another brilliant game from Alea.
Sold in my game auction July 2011

item.name: Gloom
item.comment: A light card game where the winners are the most miserable. A little bit of "take that" as players are trying to affect each other's families. Awesome use of clear cards to overlap each other.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: A very complicated card game that is easier to learn than Race for the Galaxy, but just barely. This game ends up taking a huge amount of space and is very fiddly. However, there is a ton of tactics and strategy in this one and it deserves a home in your collection if you like complex games with lots of interaction.

item.name: Go
item.comment: Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Goa
item.comment: My brain hurts just thinking about this game. It's incredibly brain-buring, but oh so good. Everything is very tight in Goa which just makes it that much harder.

item.name: God's Playground
item.comment:
It's quite long, and has about half a million tiny rules that are easy to miss or play wrong. There's also a lot of reliance on dice which I really don't think belongs in a 3 hour game. To have plans destroyed by bad rolls is a problem in such a long, heavy game.
But I actually liked it and want to play again. It's not something I'm clamoring for, but I want to give it one more spin.

item.name: Gold!
item.comment:
Our first play has left us quite impressed. The game is ridiculously simple and yet there's a ton of choices. The endgame scoring is amazing as it really requires you to manage your cards carefully. I'm not sure how to balance it all yet, but I can't wait to figure it out.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com on 6/7/2011

item.name: Gonzaga
item.comment:
Awesome game. The planning is brilliant and the I love how you can't use the same card 2 turns in a row. That really makes this game shine. Works brilliantly with 2. Looking forward to playing with 3 and 4, although I suspect 3 will be the hot spot.
Traded away on 4/15/2011.

item.name: GOSU
item.comment:
Tons of card interaction. Really interesting decisions as you try to manipulate your cards to do what you want. Way to much downtime for more than 2 players.
OLD NOTES - Purchased in Fall of 2010. Played for about 15 minutes and neither my wife nor I fell in love so it didn't make the cut.
Traded to epilgrim on 1/28/2011. Maybe I'll get a chance to play it with him.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment:
Received in trade with DKahnt. Not sure of date.
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Grave Business
item.comment: Received a review copy on 4/9/12.

item.name: Gravediggers
item.comment: A decent blind-bidding game with some double-guessing going on. Fairly quick game that offers some interesting choices. It's nothing amazing, but it's not bad and is worth getting if you can get it on the cheap.

item.name: Gravwell: Escape from the 9th Dimension
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: The Great Chili Cookoff
item.comment: I give this game a rating of 3 because I feel that it is just way too random if played according to the rules. I think there needs to be a better way to play this game and if I figure that out, the rating could be higher. I have some high hopes to make this game playable, but out of the box its just way too random to bother playing.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment:
This is a great climbing game that scales pretty well. Its fun and silly but there is room for good play as well. I like it as a closer or opener on game night. Plays very well with 6 players.
Purchased from Boardsandbits.com - July 2010

item.name: Great Wall of China
item.comment:
Purchased at WBC 2007
So close to perfection. If only it worked for 2 better than it does. Otherwise, this game is flawless. Probably the best 3-player game I can think of.
One of my favorite games of all time that I just couldn't get anyone to play. Traded in September 2011 Almost-instant Gratification Math Trade.

item.name: Greed
item.comment: A very simple push-your-luck dice game. Not too many real decisions to make, but if you want something simple to kill time this could work perfectly.

item.name: Grimoire
item.comment:
What a fantastic game. It's sort of a simultaneous role-selection game/blind bid game which is augmented by getting cards that reward you for certain actions. It's very simple, but the interaction between the players is what makes it really tick.
I'm thinking this game is best at the max player count of 5. I'll bet that's the only way to get real interaction because with less it may be too easy to dodge each other.
Purchased from CSI 8/16/11
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: GUBS: A Game of Wit and Luck
item.comment:
Designer gave me a copy for reviewing - 2008
Very light, but a lot of fun with the right crowd. Best played with at least 3. Terrific filler.
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Guildhall
item.comment: I like the game at first blush, but HOLY EUROGLYPHICS, BATMAN!

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment:
Purchased from FLGS - 2008
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009
Purchased from Vault of Midnight on 8/10/12.

item.name: Hacienda
item.comment: Why play this when you can play Through the Desert? It's damn near the same idea although Hacienda adds rules that just make the game more cumbersome, not better. I'll take Knizia's take on Go instead of Kramer's. Further proof that I am not a Kramer fan.

item.name: Haggis
item.comment: Bought from Indie Cards & Games in May 2010

item.name: Halli Galli
item.comment:
I was hoping this would be a fun diversion from Jungle Speed, but it's pretty drastically inferior. I think there needs to be more cards in the deck because it really wasn't enough cards with 6 people. It's not bad, but it's not great either.
Purchased from CSI in late April 2010

item.name: Halo ActionClix
item.comment: Fun and fast. This game is non-stop action from the first turn. A lot of the tactics revolve around who to kill and which figure should do it. Upgrading is a neat rule.

item.name: Hamburgum
item.comment: In my first game of Hamburgum, I learned that I like the rondel. However, I don't like games where I'm churning goods into other goods into other goods into victory points. On that level Hamburgum fails for me but the good news is that I know that I like the rondel mechanism and now look forward to trying other Gerdts games. However I will not likely play Hamburgum again although I would take one for the team if necessary.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment:
This game is HARD! I need more plays to properly formulate an opinion.
A birthday present from my awesome wife, 5/7/12.

item.name: The Hanging Gardens
item.comment:
An excellent game of spacial analyses coupled with a nice blend of strategy and tactics. It's a bit light and I wish it played more people, but Hanging Gardens is a great game to break the ice. There's almost a puzzle element to the game that makes it feel quite challenging. The art is quite nice and the overall presentation is pretty. Eye and brain pleasing all at the same time.
Gift from Guantanamo - August 2008

item.name: Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage
item.comment: Birthday Present from Cait - 2008

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: I hate this game, but I do respect it's design. I can't stand games where you get something, turn it into something else, and then use it. That's what Le Havre is all about. So many little pieces and so much fiddliness. Maybe this one is just too heavy for me, but I found it anything but fun.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment:
I have a hard time believing adults play this. If I had this when I was 10 it would have been the greatest thing ever. Acquiring it and trying it with my wife when I was 29 made me feel like a tool.
This is a dice-fest. Tactics and strategy don't mean a damn thing, except maybe for army creation. After that, it's a dice fest with no meaningful choices.

item.name: Der Hexer von Salem
item.comment: Purchased early 2009

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment:
This is a great game, but if you are clearly better than your opponent, it will seem too easy and boring. Its really important that both players understand how this game works to make it challenging.
I think this game is drastically better on the internet than in person. It really helps you to get perspective on the board when you can see it top down.
Reacquired a copy in June 2011 via math trade.

item.name: High Society
item.comment: Homemade copy made in early 2009

item.name: Highlander: The Card Game
item.comment:
I really do love the swordfighting in this game. It's actually a really great system. Unfortunately, the rest of the cards are a bit strange. You can win without ever swinging your sword. What the hell is that all about?
I've not played the new version that came out a few years ago so I can't comment on how well that works or how different it is.

item.name: Hive
item.comment:
One play, and I don't feel that I "got" this one. I really want to try it again.
I rebought this one. I've been playing on the iTouch and loving it so I figured I should try again. I'm hoping my wife will like this as much as I do.
********EDIT********
Oh wow. Just wow. What an awesome little game. It's incredibly simple but very complex. It feels like very game comes down to one lynch-pin moment, but you never know exactly when that moment is coming.
Purchased from Thor at Gamesurplus.com on 3/28/2011.

item.name: Hoity Toity
item.comment: Hoity Toity felt incredibly repetitive to me. It was really not enjoyable and seemed to drag for a long time. I think this game has shown it's age and it's time is now passed.

item.name: Hold the Line
item.comment:
A very light wargame that is simple enough for my wife to enjoy without being a burden on the rules. It's a simple dicefest with a bit of maneuvering. I like that it's historical in nature.
Acquired in a trade in May 2010.
Sold off in one of my myriad game auctions.
Reacquired at the WBC 2011.
Traded away in the Labor of Love Math Trade.

item.name: Homeland: The Game
item.comment: People like Dark Moon a lot, but for my money, this game is WAY better. It's quicker, provides a lot of tension, and actually feels like you're doing something instead of just rolling dice.

item.name: Homesteaders
item.comment:
This is a great economic engine game. I love the multiple paths to victory and that they all seem to be balanced. I will certainly play this one if asked.
The components are okay, but not great. The price is fairly low and this is a smaller publisher so I can cut some slack.

item.name: Hornet
item.comment:
This game combines simultaneous action selection and area majority in a really great little package. The rules are very intuitive but the interaction between the players is where the game lies. I love the safe/aggressive card options which really reward careful planning.
Fantastic pieces and presentation as well. This is a game I'd really like to own.
Christmas in July present from my Guantanamo Bay Secret Santa. Thanks, Santa!
I have an extra copy for trade. Hit me up!

item.name: A House Divided
item.comment: I played about half a game of this and wasn't impressed. It seems a bit too simple. In fairness though, I don't think I like wargames very much so this one may be lost on me a bit.

item.name: If Wishes Were Fishes!
item.comment: A really cute game that has some great choices. This looks like it should be a family game, and most of the game works well for that. The downside is a lot of things are very fiddly and are full of exceptions. I like this one, but it's a bit too much work to play it right.

item.name: The Impossible Machine
item.comment: A very simple game of matching cards up. Seems like it's incredibly luck dependent to the point of almost not being fun. I don't really like the way the game works, but it's fun enough for me to play as a time killer. It's not great, but it works.

item.name: In the Shadow of the Emperor
item.comment: I really didn't like this game. It was just tedious and not fun in any way. I felt like I got screwed right away as I was going last and had one of my people taken away before I could do anything about it. From turn 1, I was in a hole. Any game that has situations like that can go away.

item.name: Incan Gold
item.comment: A great filler game that last the perfect amount of time and offers real tension. I really like this as my go-to "push-your-luck" game over others such as Cloud 9 and its ilk.

item.name: Indigo
item.comment: First game puts this at a 7. We liked it a lot as a 2-player and I think there's a lot more to discover.

item.name: Infinite City
item.comment:
I love tile-laying games, and this is not exception. I really like how it's basically an area-majority game done with tiles. There's a lot of chaos going on here so you need to stay on your toes and keep your options open. I think it's likely best with 2 players although 3 seems reasonable enough. Any more than that and things will get messy very quickly.
Traded away on 4/15/2011.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment:
One of the greatest abstracts I've ever played. Works incredibly well for 2, 3, or 4 players. Doesn't outstay its welcome in any way. Very easy to learn, hard to master. I love the scoring system in this game.
My only complaint is that the scoring is a bit tricky for new players. Once you get the hang of it then you're golden.
Purchased in January 2009

item.name: Ingenious Challenges
item.comment:
I call false advertising on this one. The title says Ingenious Challenges, but there is nothing ingenious or challenging about this game. It's 3 pure luck exercises without fun or challenge. Reiner Knizia and Fantasy Flight Games should be ashamed of themselves for putting this out.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com 9/4/10

item.name: Ingenious: Travel Edition
item.comment:
Ingenious is a great game and this is a solid version. I love how the tiles lock onto the board. I don't love the scoring pegs as they are a bit tedious to use.
If you love Ingenious and want something that's more portable, this is a good choice although it's only a 2-player game.

item.name: Innovation
item.comment:
Innovation is an obvious decendent of Glory to Rome from the same designer. The "take that" of GtR is obvious here and also augmented.
The design of the game is solid and I'm pretty impressed at how balanced all the cards seem. However, I don't like the wild swings of fortune and I really don't like having my stuff stolen and my plans completely altered. I'll take a bit less "take that" in my games.

item.name: The Institute for Magical Arts
item.comment: This is a wonderfully tense 2-player battle. You get the trademark dice management found in most of Dr. Finn's games. Plus you get an awesome area majority mechanism that features a cool twist with the differentials. Awesome game with a lot of depth and replayability.

item.name: Intrigue
item.comment:
The most vicious and evil game I've ever played. Truly dastardly and skullduggerous players will win. I actually feel bad about some of the things you have to do when you play this game. Really nasty....
But also incredibly good! You're really just playing the people, the game is secondary. It's an amazing experience to see how evil you can be.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics on 2/20/12

item.name: Irondale
item.comment:
Preliminary rating is a 6, but I expect that to rise a bit. I think you need to know what is in the decks in order to make this one strategic instead of purely tactical.
Review copy courtesy of Small Box Games. Received 2/24/09

item.name: La Isla
item.comment:
First play - I really like the game. It's got so much going on in typical Feld fashion, but this one is a lot more accessible. Brilliant use of cards.
Be warned. There's a lot of Euroglyphics in this game and the player aids suck.

item.name: The Isle of Doctor Necreaux
item.comment: Pretty good game. Its a bit long, but I can see that shortening up with some repeated plays.

item.name: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
item.comment: Tile laying game with really awesome variety of scoring.

item.name: Isolate
item.comment:
Christmas Present for wife - 2008
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Istanbul
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: It Happens..
item.comment:
A very pleasant little dice game that has some touch choices. I like how you have to manage your timing and also your die rolls. I'm thinking this may be a "more the merrier" game, but it works pretty well with 2 as well. I like the use of the extra dice to act as a dummy player.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics in Cedar Grove, NJ on August 27, 2011.
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: JAB: Realtime Boxing
item.comment:
Not sure where the strategy is in this game. It seems incredibly random and lacking control.
My super-awesome wife bought this for me from our FLGS on 8/18/11.
Traded in September 2011 Almost-instant Gratification Math Trade.

item.name: Jaipur
item.comment:
A very light set collection game for 2 players. Nice looking components. Lots of luck makes this a great non-gamer game. There's not a lot of decision to be made, if any.
I'd rather play Lost Cities as it creates a lot of tension which is definitely missing from Jaipur.

item.name: James Rizzi
item.comment: A fairly enjoyable 2-player climbing game which requires a bit of skill but also a dose of good luck.

item.name: Jenga
item.comment: A classic game of dexterity. It's a bit silly because it's solved. Just take the middle one every time. Ultimately someone will have to take a piece which breaks the puzzle. It's quite flawed in that regard.

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment:
This is without a doubt the all-time greatest reaction game. Jungle Speed pits your eye/hand coordination against the other people at the table in a way that is seldom seen. The game is almost dangerous based on how fast you need to move, but that's part of the fun. Play this with experts and it's one step below a ninja action film.
If you like reaction/reflex/speed games, this is the king.
Purchased at FLGS summer 2008

item.name: Jungle Speed: The Extreme Expansion
item.comment:
As awesome as Jungle Speed is, this just makes the game too damn hard. It's a shame really, because the ideas present are awesome, especially the card which requires everyone to put their hand on top of the totem. Unfortunately the shape cards are almost indistinguishable turning the game into an exercise of party fouls and penalties. Buy Jungle Speed but keep the expansion at the store.
Birthday Present 2009
Sold in my game auction July 2011

item.name: Junta
item.comment: A fun game of negotiation and power. Lots of backstabbing and broken alliances provide fun. The game takes a long time and some of the rules are fiddly.

item.name: Junta: Viva el Presidente!
item.comment: While it's true that this game does take most of the boring out of Junta, it strips it down too far. There aren't quite enough turns and there's really not enough going on. I'll play if asked, but won't suggest it.

item.name: Just4Fun
item.comment: Just 4 What? No fun here, only tedious repetitive card play that requires way too much luck. The design works, but I have no interest in playing this ever again. I guess it would work well for kids as it would aid them in learning math, so for that sake, I'll give it a slightly higher rating.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment:
A VERY light dice game in which you smash each other to pieces. It's a bit too easy as well which takes just a bit of the fun out of it for me. I like fun simple games, but this one may be too much so.
I'll play it anytime someone asks however because it's short.

item.name: King's Breakfast
item.comment:
King's Breakfast is a wonderful set collection game with a bit of a memory aspect. It's a quick filler that plays in under 20 minutes. Easy enough for kids yet fun for adults. My family and I enjoy this one quite a bit more than we initially thought we would.
Purchased at 2009 WBC

item.name: King's Gate
item.comment: Purchased 4/27/09

item.name: Kingdom Builder
item.comment:
This game is devoid of almost any decisions and is decidedly unfunded. I like easy light games but this offers nothing at all.
****EDIT****
Wow, was I wrong on my first couple plays. This game is brilliant, but it's really the little things that make it good. You have to exploit the rules wherever possible and maximize usage of the special tiles. The Devil is in the details.

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: Oh, hi there, Math In A Box.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment: Purchased 3/18/08 Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Kingsburg: To Forge a Realm
item.comment: Purchased from Game Surplus 8/7/09 Traded to Dave Kahnt with some other stuff for Robo Rally. 9/7/09

item.name: Kittens in a Blender
item.comment:
KiB is a pretty fun card game. There's a lot of take-that going on. Very simple rules and a good amount of fun. There's nothing new or innovative here, but if you want a fun way to pass some time this is a great choice for $10.
Some may be put off by the theme. I thought it was funny so long as you realize it's all in jest.

item.name: Knights of Charlemagne
item.comment:
This is a perfect game for 3 players. Short playtime and tough choices make this game a winner. It works pretty well for 2, but 3 is ideal.
Purchased from Dark Tower Games in 2008.

item.name: Knights of Ten
item.comment: Received a review copy on 4/30/12.

item.name: Lancaster
item.comment:
My wife and I both loved our first game of this. Worker placement is one of our favorite mechanics and this game does it incredibly well. I love the strength of the knights and how you can kick people out of spaces. It's really quite awesome. I felt the laws were a bit tacked on, but it did give you something else to worry about which added tension.
This is a solid game and one I will eagerly play again if asked. I won't own it because I have 2-player games with dummy bits but I'll gladly play when the occassion arises.

item.name: Langfinger
item.comment:
This game is the very essence of "less is more". Incredibly minimalistic rules that drive some fun choices. Nothing too tough, but occasionally you've got a decision to make that really matters. The short play time really helps distill this one down to a lot of fun in a small package.
We were surprised at how well this played for 2. I'm actually really excited to try it with more but it worked fine at that number.
*********EDIT************
Much better with 3 than with 2. Light, fast, and fun. This is a terrific gateway game.
Purchased at Time Warp Comics on 2/20/12

item.name: Lascaux
item.comment:
This is a more complex and likely deeper version of No Thanks! However the elegant simplicity of NT is obscured in additional rules. This is a solid game, but I'd rather play No Thanks!
Additionally, the cost is way too high on this game.

item.name: Last Night on Earth Special Edition Soundtrack CD
item.comment:
Why the hell is this listed as a game? It's a CD soundtrack for a game, not a game itself.
I do like it because it's kind of atmospheric. Not required to play or enjoy Last Night on Earth, but a fun addition.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
item.comment:
A nice expansion offering more boards, cards, characters, and scenarios.
A lot of the boards are discolored in the early prints of this so don't be surprised if your new board pieces don't match the ones in the base game.

item.name: Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
item.comment:
This is really a great zombie game. I've just never found people who really want to play it.
If you like zombies, this is a sure thing. The game play is fun and fast and the game is easy to teach. You can have new players up and running in no time.
The important thing to remember here is that this is a game where the experience matters far more than who wins or loses. They call that "Ameritrash" around these parts.
********************EDIT 01/06/2011**********************
I finally got to play this game with a group of people who were all about having fun. We had some great moments that I'll remember forever. A total blast. Sure, we got crushed as the heroes, but I think everyone had a great time.
I've upped my rating to 7/10. It was at a 4 before, but I think I let bad experiences mar my rating.

item.name: Last Will
item.comment:
An interest engine building game where you're spending your money as opposed to trying to earn more. I like how the property works, especially the depreciation. This game is simple on the whole, but some of the inconography is a bit screwy. It's too complex for a gateway game, but it's also a bit light for a gamer's game. This one sits in a weird place.
I'd play this again if asked, but it's not my absolute favorite.

item.name: Leader 1
item.comment:
Christmas Present 2008
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Leaping Lemmings
item.comment:
LL is a great little game. I love the movement rules which are simple and yet provide a lot of strategy. The eagles are great and really cause a bit of push-your-luck as well as tactical positioning. The 2-player variant rules are spectacularly good.
A big applause for GMT games stepping even further out of the wargame box.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com in mid September 2010
Traded away in a Math Trade - February 2011

item.name: Letters from Whitechapel
item.comment:
Playing as Jack is incredibly fun. You get to dodge and avoid the police while killing victims. The downside is that being a detective is outright terrible. Jack is gone after the first turn and there's almost nothing you can do to find him again, aside from getting incredibly lucky. There's too much stuff on the board to get in the way of adjacency.
If I could always play Jack, I'd rate this a 6. Since I'd likely have to play a detective, which I'd never want to do, I'll rate it a 3.
Purchased from CSI March 17, 2011.
Sold this boring pile of crap in my May 2011 game auction.

item.name: Level X
item.comment:
This is a really great little dice game. It's incredibly simple, but it's a lot of fun. There's some push-your-luck in here and a bit of player interaction. If you want an easy 20 minute filler, this is a great choice.
Purchased from GameSurplus.com on 2/17/2011.
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Liar's Dice
item.comment: I rate this game a 7. It scores a perfect 10 as a drinking game but only a 4 without alcohol.

item.name: Libert√©
item.comment:
Martin Wallace is a fun-murderer extraordinaire. He has a penchant for designing games that I really like mechanically, but are incredibly unfun to play. This one falls firmly in that grasp. I hate not drawing cards that really help me.
This was the last Wallace game I will ever play.

item.name: Liebe & Intrige
item.comment:
Valentine's Day present for my wife 2010
First play was okay. I neglected to print out the event cards in English so we played without them. Also, I don't think this game is meant for 2 players as there's just not enough competition for the gentlemen.

item.name: Lifeboat
item.comment:
Not a bad game, per se, but I think it shouldn't be played with less than 6 people. It's just not fun that way.
If I want to play a game with a big group, I'm going Shadow Hunters every time.

item.name: London
item.comment:
This one reminds me of Race for the Galaxy, but with more stuff built in and less variety. You're basically trying to create an engine with cards while fighting off a very interesting poverty mechanism. There's a nice balancing act going on and it seems like there are lots of ways to play well.
I wasn't enamored with this game and truthfully I'd much rather play RftG. It's a decent game, but the price tag is ridiculous.

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment:
This is a children's game. Just keep telling yourself that as you sit and play it over and over and over with 3 other adults. Loopin' Louie is one of the most addicting games I've ever played. It's a dexterity game at heart as you try to deftly maneuver Louie to take out your opponents' chickens. Deeper than that, it's a whole lot of laughs and outright silliness in one box.
Purchased from Shire Games in late February/early March 2009

item.name: Loot
item.comment:
Purchased at WalMart in 2008
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Looting London
item.comment:
First play as a 2-player revealed a surprising amount of depth. There's a lot going on here and I can't wait to see what more plays unearth. It's a 6.5 now but I'm pretty sure this will rise with more plays.
A birthday gift from my buddy Geof.
Traded in September 2011 Almost-instant Gratification Math Trade.

item.name: Lord of the Rings
item.comment:
My first play was a solo game and I actually really enjoyed it. I look forward to playing it with more people as I think it will really shine. I like co-op games in general and this is no exception.
One of my favorite things is that the theme is actually tied into the gameplay. The game gets progressively harder, just as the quest to destroy the ring does.
Traded in May 2011 Math Trade
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com on 9/21/10
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
item.comment:
I was sure that I was not going to like this game. But I also said that about Magic and Warcraft! Turns out that I was wrong. There's tons of things to like about this game. Building synergy in a deck is really important and I think that creates lots of fun. The chapter packs offer so much variety and choice that I don't see this game getting old any time soon. I really NEED to get this one sooner rather than later.
Purchased from Game Surplus on 11/10/11.
Sold in my Christmas auction 2012.

item.name: Lords of Vegas
item.comment: The game starts of so slow I was really worried about it being boring. However, it quickly accelerates into a really fun mix between a dice game and Acquire. The mechanisms are really neat and produce a truly fun experience. There's plenty of room for tactics, but there's also a lot of luck. The one word that I kept thinking after playing was "FUN".

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep
item.comment: Fantastic worker placement game. Straight-forward rules, good iconography, and a terrific rulebook. Short length but packed with decisions. I love the screeage from the Intrigue cards.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment:
This is a great game for 2 players. Simple, yet some good choices. The deck working as the time limit is brilliant and adds nice tension to the game. I love this one.
Okay, I don't love it. My wife does. I like it well enough to play it with her so that's good by me.
Owned this a couple times now. Repurchased on 6/10 at Vault of Midnight in Ann Arbor, MI.

item.name: Lost Cities: The Board Game
item.comment:
Goodbye Lost Cities, hello the board game! I love how this takes a 2-player game and makes it work for 4. The paths will always be different because of the way the bonus tiles are laid out. I also love the step bonus tile as it can really help you get out of a jam. The artifacts are cool too.
I also think the board is quite nice to look at.
Sold in my Fall auction 2011.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: So much game in 16 little cards. A brilliant filler.

item.name: Luchador! Mexican Wrestling Dice
item.comment:
This game is pretty much perfect. It's a modern Ameritrash classic. If you like wrestling, this is easily the game for you.
IT HAS A RING!!

item.name: Luna
item.comment:
Man, this is one interesting game. There's a ton of choices available to you on every turn so it can be a lot to consider at first, but this is one of those interesting games that plays backwards offering infinite choices at first and less as the game goes on.
Great artwork and presentation add a nice touch to it. I don't think one game is quite fair to rate this one, but I'll start at 7/10 as of 2/19/11.
Valentine's Day present from my wife in 2011.
Traded away on 4/15/2011. This one was replaced by Bombay for us. It felt the same, but more fun.

item.name: Lungarno
item.comment:
Purchased 2/11/09
I rate this game a 3 because honestly, its very boring. Mechanically it works. But there's no spark. There's nothing to make me say "Yeah, I'd play this again." I'm pretty sure I won't. I thought about rating it a 4, but that means I could be talked into it. I'd rather not play this again.
I think I've learned a valuable lesson that has taken quite a while to learn: If someone says that a game is like Carcassonne, they basically mean that it has tiles.
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: M
item.comment:
An interesting multiplayer abstract game. Rules are very simple. First play felt really luck heavy. Need to give it a shot with more people before reaching my final conclusion. The wife really liked it so it stays in the collection.
Purchased from Gamesurplus.com 9/4/10
Sold in my game auction July 2011

item.name: Macao
item.comment:
Half of my first play was terrible, the other half was better. I literally almost quit 30 minutes in. Thankfully, I stuck it out. I'm going to play this again and it best go better than the first time.
After game 2, I can say that this game has a really neat use of dice that is both ingenious and wildly frustrating. Feld really makes you work in this game. Superbly challenging.
*********************EDIT******************
I truly hate this game. It's frustrating beyond all belief. I'll never play it again and actively hate it.
Purchased from CSI 8/16/2011
Traded on 2/20/12 for Wrasslin'.

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment:
5 hours of tension and thinking ahead. Can German politics be fun? They sure as hell can be. Die Macher is a classic and it deserves its status. I've never seen such an intricate design that requires so much foresight. It's truly incredible how well the multiple layers intertwine.
I would LOVE to play this again.

item.name: Machi Koro
item.comment:
I don't honestly think I've had more pure fun with a game in a very long time.
This game needs more cards to be totally awesome.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering
item.comment:
Purchased sometime in my youth. Got back into this during the summer of 2008.
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Magical Athlete
item.comment:
Clearly I'm an idiot. I owned this game for about 6 months and never played it. I then gave it away in a Christmas exchange only to repurchase it 10 months later. I finally got it played and....
WOW! Roll and move should not be so much fun. This game takes a super-simple concept and makes it into a total blast. There's just enough game here to make some interesting decisions in the draft. Once you start racing, all Hell breaks loose!
Buy this game and play it.
Gifted in Secret Satan 2010 on F:AT.
Re-purchased from Boards & Bits 10/25/2011

item.name: Maharani
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Malifaux
item.comment:
I think I finally found a miniatures game for me. Minimal amounts of measuring is a big plus. There's a lot of rules, but the basics are really cool. I love the management of soulstones and cards in your hand as this adds a cool resource-management aspect to the game. I also like the variety of pieces, the setting and the overall feel of the game.
Received in trade with epilgrim on 1/28/2011. Received Viktorias, Lady Justice, 2 Fate decks, the rules, and some random figures.
Sold in my game auction July 2011
I think I may need to get some more of these.

item.name: Mall of Horror
item.comment:
Received in trade at 2009 WBC
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Mamma Mia!
item.comment: Purchased 5/6/09

item.name: The Manhattan Project
item.comment: An anniversary present for my wife and I. 4/5/12

item.name: The Manhattan Project: Nations Expansion
item.comment: An anniversary present for my wife and I. 4/5/12

item.name: Manoeuvre
item.comment:
This is the be all, end all of introductory wargames although it's not really a wargame at all. It's more of an abstraction than most others, but it's a truly fun game to play. The mix of hand management combined with the luck of the dice brings some tense and fun moments. The terrain creates incredible scenarios as players vie for supremacy in one area or another. I love that you can play a game of Manoeuvre in about an hour including chit chat and messing around.
Purchased from Pozy - early 2008
Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: Maori
item.comment:
This is a wonderful tile-laying game that also has a nice bit of resource management. Fairly light and easy to teach, Maori makes a nice entry to Euros.
Maori is reasonably priced and is family friendly. I recommend this game to anyone looking for something light that still offers some challenge. It's one of my personal favorites.
Purchased at 2009 WBC

item.name: Mars Attacks: The Dice Game
item.comment: Multi-player dice chucking fun. This is a perfect lunchtime game. Plays up to 6 and plays in 30 minutes.

item.name: Martian Dice
item.comment:
I think this is a great dice game in the vein of Zombie dice or other simple games like that. It's got a great push-your-luck mechanism going on. I'd highly recommend this for anyone who wants a fast and easy dice game with some tough choices.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics on 10/16/2011

item.name: Martinique
item.comment: An awesome game that combines deduction with Hey! That's My Fish. I really need to play it more, but it's an interesting mix of tactics. If one person goes for the treasure but doesn't get it, the other will have tons of points. I love the aspect of the bar seating for final pick of treasure location. That adds a whole new level to the game. A review will follow as soon as I get another couple plays in.

item.name: Masons
item.comment: A fun dice game with some interesting choices on when to play cards. It's quite light as luck of the dice and cards plays a huge roll. I recommend this one as a nice couples game.

item.name: Master Builder
item.comment:
This is a very light auction game in which players recruit workers and build a city. There's a few small auctions in the game but the heart of it comes down to the workers. Each turn some of your workers won't work. You have to balance them out so you don't get overly affected.
The pieces are incredible. When I say "you build a building" you literally build it. The various building pieces go together and you end up with a 3D building. The final presentation is very cool.
It's simple and easy to teach. I think this could make a great family game. For gamers, I don't think there's enough there to make it worth the while.

item.name: Master of Rules
item.comment:
Purchased at 2009 WBC
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Math Wiz
item.comment:
A decent little math card game. Would work really well to teach or reinforce math concepts. The game is a bit lame, but I'd still own it for the reasons stated earlier.
This is one game that schools could make great use of.

item.name: Medici
item.comment: Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment:
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009 Reacquired in March 2010 via Math Trade.
Sold in my game auction July 2011

item.name: Merchant of Venus (second edition)
item.comment:
Amazing game of pick up and deliver. It's mostly multi-player solitaire but it's a fun race to see who can do what. I love the market tiles in the FFG version. Some of the game feels like unnecessary chrome, but the overall package is quite amazing. It's a bit clunky, but a wonderful experience overall.
Too long for one sitting, so my wife and I play it over a couple days.

item.name: Merchants
item.comment:
A blind Knizia purchase that looks pretty solid. I'm not sure how much it will stand out from the others, but I'll give it a play before I get rid of it.
My family loved this one! I found it to be completely unlike any games that I've played before. It's very unique in it's gameplay. Another winner from Knizia.

item.name: Metropolys
item.comment: Purchased 6/18/08

item.name: Midgard
item.comment:
Man, I really like this game. If you take Fairy Tale and put an actual game on the end of the drafting then you've got Midgard.
I think this one is definitely best with 5 as it creates a lot of fighting and tension. I think the board may shrink with less players, but I'm convinced 5 is the way to go.

item.name: Minotaur Lords
item.comment:
A really cool game which feels like Battle Line with special powers. My wife really took to it which means it will see a lot of plays.
Purchased from our FLGS, Mighty Titans Hobbies and Games on 1/10/12 for $4. What a steal.

item.name: Mondo
item.comment:
If you like puzzle games, Mondo is a good choice. It plays up to 4 in one box, but you can expand is you have more copies. I really recommend playing this with the full rules as it increases the difficulty of the game tremendously and turns it into a nice game with tough decisions about how you build your island.
****EDIT****
I upgraded my rating from 6.5 to 7. This game is a lot more fun when played with more than 2 players. The competition for tiles makes it much tougher to get what you want. It also really puts a wrinkle in the bonus tiles.
Purchased from Boards & Bits 10/25/2011

item.name: Money!
item.comment: Purchased 3/5/09

item.name: Monkey Lab
item.comment: Christmas present 2009

item.name: Monopoly Deal Card Game
item.comment:
Purchased at WalMart - 2009
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Monopoly Express
item.comment: Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Monopoly: The Card Game
item.comment: Purchased at mall - January 2009

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: If you like Fluxx and you like Monty Python this is a winner. Usual Fluxx craziness combined with the randomness of Monty Python combine for a lot of fun.

item.name: Mordred
item.comment:
Mordred is one of the lighter Wallace games, but I also think it's quite vanilla. It works and has some neat ideas, but it felt a little plain.
I think this would be a great game to play with slightly older kids as a real gateway. It's perfect for that situation.

item.name: Morels
item.comment:
This is a really tough set collection game. I'm a fan of trying to manage the many different options to stay under hand size. I want to play this again soon.
Purchased from the designer 07/11.

item.name: Mosaix
item.comment:
Mosaix takes the puzzle game and adds a wonderful new component: luck. I love the aspect of having a bit of control and then none as turns move around the table. It's a very thinky game for something so simple.
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Mother Sheep
item.comment: Purchased from Dark Tower Games early December 2009

item.name: Mountain of Inferno
item.comment:
This is a pattern recognition game created by playing cards. Alas, the cards have no text at all and are only identified by the art. This makes the game very hard to teach. Alas, its not worth it for a game like this when I have literally dozens of other games that are better.
Purchased as the WBC August 7, 2010

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment: One of the great asymmetrical 2-player games available. Incredibly deep game play hidden under a layer of cuteness. This one will melt your brain and leave you wanting more.

item.name: Mr. Jack in New York
item.comment:
Valentine's Day gift from my wife. I think she secretly bought this one for herself.
I know I sold this game, I just can't remember when or how.

item.name: Mr. Jack Pocket
item.comment:
Distills the theme and gameplay of the original down to a very nice portable package. I still felt like I was playing Mr. Jack which was awesome.
Also, this is much easier to teach new players.

item.name: M√º & More
item.comment: We played one of the games in the rules, but it wasn't Mu. Something about a panther if I recall. At any rate, Mu is incredibly complex for a trick-taking game so it scared us off. The other games are good too, but much easier to learn and play.

item.name: Munchkin Cthulhu
item.comment: Not as bad as the haters say but not particularly compelling either. Id rather play Cutthroats Caverns.

item.name: Mysterium
item.comment: This is a perfect co-op. There's no alpha player at all. A bit of extraneous chrome with the intuition track, but still completely awesome.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Jekyll & Hyde
item.comment: Purchased 4/20/09 Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Murders in the Rue Morgue
item.comment: Much better than Jeckyll & Hyde, but I'm still not sold on this series. I'd rather play rummy with regular cards.

item.name: Napoleon Dynamite: It's Pretty Much My Favorite Animal Game
item.comment:
This is a pretty fun little party game, although it gets boring quickly. It's also too much fun to draw one animal and then add on the other part of it. Way more fun with people that can't draw.
Acquired in a math trade in December 2008.

item.name: Navegador
item.comment:
After my first play of the uber-boring Hamburgum, I wasn't sure I wanted to revisit the rondel. Boy, am I glad I did. Navegador takes a great mechanism and builds a superb game around it. What's particularly interesting about Navegador is that every single action is useful at almost every time. What you end up doing is working to make sure you maximize every one of those actions.
The market in the game is pure awesome. I love how as more stuff gets sold the price drops, but that incents people to produce the product instead of selling it, thus driving the cost back up. It's really quite awesome and is enough to make the game great by itself.
I'll rate this one an 8 to start. I hope I get to play this one more because it really could climb quite a bit.

item.name: Nefarious
item.comment:
One 2-player game so far, but I like it. Nefarious is a very light action-selection game. Very simple, but a good filler game that accommodates a nice player count.
Purchased at Get Your Game On in Ann Arbor, MI. 6/10/12
Traded for Warhammer Invasion, August 2012.

item.name: Nefertiti
item.comment:
A very non-descript auction game that neither impressed me or turned me completely off. It works, it looks well enough, and it's manageable in the time/complexity factor.
Unfortunately, mediocrity means I'll likely never play it again.

item.name: Nertz
item.comment:
Sigh. My wife and her family love this ridiculous game. It's multiplayer solitaire, but not in the traditional meaning on BGG. You play this as fast as possible.
It's not a terrible game, but I lose interest after about 4 hands.

item.name: Netrunner
item.comment:
An incredible asymetrical 2-player CCG that did not live nearly long enough. The strategy is incredible with both sides being COMPLETELY different. It's easier to win as the Corp, but more satisfying to win as the Runner.
If this game ever came out as an LCG then I'd be all over it. Unfortunately, cards for this are hard to find and can be quite expensive.
I firmly believe this is the best CCG ever published.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: Purchased from KB Toys online in April 2007. This is the first game I bought thanks to BGG.

item.name: NHL Ice Breaker: The Card Hockey Board Game
item.comment: Purchased at 2007 WBC

item.name: Nightfall
item.comment:
This is an incredibly hard deck builder. The rules are easy but making a chain work is really really tough. You want to be able to chain your cards but you also need to be able to play off your opponents stuff. This one will take a bunch of plays to learn to play really well.
I don't particularly like deck builders so this one won't be purchased.

item.name: Ninety-Nine
item.comment:
This is a decent trick-taking game which has a nice bidding system. I like the scoring mechanism.
As a trick-taking fan, I like this one although it's not my favorite.

item.name: No Thanks!
item.comment: This is absolutely the greatest filler ever made. It's perfect. Played with 4, there is no better 15 minute game.

item.name: Noble Celts
item.comment: An incredibly beautiful chess variant. Unfortunately, it's really quite difficult to see what is going on due to the strange board. What makes it gorgeous also makes it almost unplayable.

item.name: Notre Dame
item.comment: Christmas Present 2007

item.name: Nottingham
item.comment: A fun fairly simple game of set collection with some negotiation built in. It's a reasonable little game that works well for kids. I would play it if asked, but not a favorite.

item.name: Nuclear War
item.comment: Gift from my wife - 2007

item.name: Nuns on the Run
item.comment:
I've learned from playing this game that I despise hidden movement games. In addition, the rules are just a pain and really hamper what should be a fun game. All the LOS checks and checking for noises bogs down the game and really sucks the fun out.
I will not be playing this game ever again.
*****EDIT*****
Alright, so I played it a second time. You know what? I didn't hate it. I didn't love it either. I was mostly ambivalent. I still think its far too rulesy for what it is, but I'll play so long as I don't have to the the Abbess/Prioress. Playing them is just the suck.
I won't ask to play this. I'd probably even try to dissuade the group from playing. But I'd play it if they insisted.
Purchased from Cardhaus April 2010

item.name: Nuts!
item.comment: Tons of "take that" and crude jokes makes for a fun game of collecting nuts. It's fast and accelerates pretty quickly so it doesn't outstay it's welcome. The game is fun enough to be played occassionally, but it's more about the group with this one. Have fun, laugh and enjoy yourself. Just keep your nuts to yourself.

item.name: OddVille
item.comment: First play was a bit meh. I'm not sure this is a good two-player game.

item.name: Onirim
item.comment:
Onirim is a nice little solitaire card game with some interesting hand management rules. It's a lot harder to win than it would first appear.
The most important note is that the cards are gorgeous. Beautifully done!
Purchased from CSI - August 2010
Traded away in March 2011

item.name: Oregon
item.comment:
Purchased 1/4/08
Yay! I got mine! Now I just need to play it :shake:
Played it on 2/11/08. Great game!
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009
Reacquired Spring 2010 and resold July 2010.
I like this game, but it's not great. The luck factor is huge which doesn't really bother me all that much as the game is quick and fairly light. It's a fun game that I simply adore playing on yucata.de.

item.name: Othello
item.comment:
A very simple game that has some good decisions in it. I think the winners are the people who understand about getting the edges first.
I'll play it, but I'm in no hurry.

item.name: Pacardy
item.comment: Just call this "Dumb Luck: The Card Game" and you've got a better title. There's no real game here, just lame card drawing and tedium.

item.name: Pack & Stack
item.comment:
This is a very good speed puzzle game. It's comparable to Factory Fun but is actually fun to play. Great colors in the game as well make it nice to look at.
Math Trade March 2010

item.name: Pagoda
item.comment: Two plays in and I like this one, but it does feel a bit light. Need more plays to formulate an opinion.

item.name: Pala
item.comment: This is a really interesting trick-taking game. I love the way you can blend colors. The bidding is really difficult to master as well. I rate this a 6.5, but it could go up once I get a better handle on the game.

item.name: Palabra
item.comment:
Just another word game ruined by dumb-luck drawing of special cards that multiply useless scores into monsters. The introduction of colors is just plain nonsense. The biggest offender is the "straights" that can be made that have nothing to do with words.
This is not a good game and I don't want to play it, but it's quick enough that I'd do so to humor my friends as they tolerate a lot of my games.

item.name: Palastgefl√ºster
item.comment: Not a bad game, and fairly easy to learn. The art is nice and the cheat sheet cards are a big help. My biggest problem is that I feel absolutely no control when playing this game.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Purchased at All Things Fun - 2008

item.name: Pandemic: Contagion
item.comment: A fantastic area-majority style game. Really nothing to do with Pandemic, but that doesn't stop it from being awesome. Plays in 30-45 minutes.

item.name: Pandemic: The Cure
item.comment:
The Cure is to Pandemic as Ra: Dice is to Ra. A prefect re-implementation with enough difference to make it stand out on it's own. The Cure manages to create a totally vibe thanks to the unpredictability of the dice and I think that's awesome.
Superb production values on this one to boot.

item.name: Panic Station
item.comment:
This is a great co-op with a hidden traitor element that plays in less than an hour. The way the infection passes is brilliant because it really forces you to evaluate where you're going and who you're trading with. I love the Heat Scans which tell you how the game is going.
There's a lot to like here. I can't wait for the real thing to come out.

item.name: Paperback
item.comment: When other deck-building word games come out, remember this was first. What an awesome way to blend two completely different game styles.

item.name: Parade
item.comment:
Our first 2-player game was awesome. A really great set-collection majority game. I will write more once I've played with more players.
Purchased as the WBC August 7, 2010
Given to Geof as a gift.

item.name: Parfum
item.comment: Underrated game. Lots of dice rolling. This one is very much about timing. It works reasonably well as a two-player.

item.name: Pass the Pigs
item.comment:
A very silly little "dice" game in which the dice are pigs. You roll them and score, pushing your luck until you stop or "pig out".
Fun for a very short period of time. The pigs are awesome and roll far better than you would believe.

item.name: Pastiche
item.comment:
Pastiche is unquestionably one of the nicest looking games I've ever played. It's gorgeous to behold and is made of really nice materials.
The game itself is a very simple puzzle game. There's not a lot of interaction to be spoken for and in fact it's basically non-existant. That's okay because this game works perfectly. We find that it presents a really tough challenge as you try to optimize every tile you place. It can be a bit AP-prone sometimes, but you just need to encourage the other players to plan their moves on your turn.
Its a 6.5 after our first play and I think it will go up as the play length decreases.
A birthday gift from my wife 5/4/11
Sold in my Fall auction 2011.

item.name: Patchwork
item.comment: First play was awesome. I love the timing of things. The buttons as currency and victory points is great.

item.name: Patrician
item.comment: A very light and incredibly random little game that I liked well enough to play if someone suggested it. There's very little control although I think the timing of when you do certain actions can make a HUGE difference.

item.name: Pecking Order
item.comment:
Purchased at Tuesday Morning for $2.99
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Pedrek
item.comment: This little self-published affair was incredibly vanilla. I don't remember much which is a real indictment about this game.

item.name: Peloponnes
item.comment: This game has a lot of rules for how short and light it actually is. I felt like it was a bit constrained. I'll play it if asked, but I won't seek it out. Not bad, but nothing special.

item.name: Penguin Soccer
item.comment: Really liked my first play. Need more plays.

item.name: Penny Arcade: The Game ‚Äì Gamers vs. Evil
item.comment: A very fun deck builder. I like the PVP effects and the fact that you have to kill bosses. It's pretty straightforward but also significantly more fun than many other deck-builders. I do think I'd grow tired of it if I had to play it constantly, but it's pretty fun to play occasionally.

item.name: Pergamon
item.comment:
A nice light family game with some good decisions. This game has fairly easy rules and is easy to teach. There's little downtime in this 45 minute super-filler so nobody should be getting bored waiting for their turn.
This game actually works well for 2 thanks to the dummy player who routinely wrecks your plans.
I may have to acquire this one to play with my family.

item.name: Perry Rhodan: The Cosmic League
item.comment:
I like pick-up-and-deliver games but this one is a bit vanilla. It's got simple rules but there's really no sense of development. Its just a lot of moving around with not much planning. I guess I was expecting more.
Negativity aside, this is easy enough to be a game to play with non-gaming spouses. The cards look nice as well.
Acquired in MT March 2011.
Traded away on 4/15/2011.

item.name: The Phantom Society
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Phoenix
item.comment:
Phoenix is a pretty fun hand-management game with a very nasty "screw your opponent" element. You are constantly wrecking each others' plans so the game is mostly tactical. Still it's easy to play and it looks great so it's a good spouse game.
Unfortunately this one is out of print. Someone should really pick this up.

item.name: Pick & Pack
item.comment:
Purchased 11/3/09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Pick Picknic
item.comment:
Purchased 5/6/08
Gave to Charlotte to take back to England.

item.name: Pictionary
item.comment: Found in the in-laws garage. It's an English edition with crazy English words.

item.name: Pictionary Card Game
item.comment:
Pictionary isn't a game I really like, but this version gets points for being portable and actually more fun. I love how the cards are pre-drawn so you basically assemble an image from the cards instead of drawing. That definitely poses its own set of difficulties.
For $5, you can do a LOT worse.
Christmas present for my wife 2010.

item.name: Pictomania
item.comment: What a wonderfully unique drawing game! It's totally Vlaada.

item.name: Piece o' Cake
item.comment:
Our first game of this was with botched rules. The second game had the rules right, but I don't think it grabbed us very well. I'll try it again for sure, but I have my doubts.
******************EDIT******************
I clearly didn't play this right the first couple of times I played it. This is a great little game that is very simple but is full of tough choices. A perfect filler.
Purchased from www.coolstuffinc.com on 12/30/09

item.name: Pimp: The Backhanding
item.comment:
I'll admit, I thought it was kind of funny for the first 15 minutes. Then it just kept going on and on and on and on and on......
There's really not much game here. It's light and silly, but it's not much fun. Modifier Hell. +1 this +3 that. No thank you.

item.name: Pink Treehouse
item.comment:
Beautiful looking pieces, terrible "game". It's all dumb luck.
Buy this to play other games, not Treehouse.
Purchased from Mighty Titan 01/02/2011
Given away as a gift.

item.name: Pit
item.comment: Purchased 11/3/09

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment:
Birthday Present May 2009
Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: Pizarro & Co.
item.comment:
This game felt a bit like Ra, but it was way more restrictive in that players basically got eliminated from bidding after successive rounds. It's a tough little game, but I like the way it played. Perhaps it's a bit vanilla, but the mechanisms were sound and the length was right.
Played a German copy called Magellan.

item.name: Pizza Box Football
item.comment: I'd rather play Football Strategy where at least you have a bit more control. This is a dicefest football simulation game. Roll the dice, compare to chart, rinse and repeat. No thank you. Others seem to enjoy this one but to me it seems a bit silly.

item.name: Pizza Theory
item.comment:
An incredible battle of wits for 3 players. This game really forces you to think, but it's over in 20 minutes so you're not left with brain-ache, unless you to decide to play repeatedly which you'll probably want to.
Received a review copy on 4/6/12.
Gave to Luke as a gift.

item.name: Poker
item.comment: I just don't care for Poker in any form. Maybe I'm adverse to losing my money, but I just don't have any fun. I'd rather play almost anything else.

item.name: Politico
item.comment: The first of the Small Box Games. There were some great ideas in this first offering but it suffered the same problem that all early SBGs did; it would not end!

item.name: Ponte del Diavolo
item.comment: This is a solid abstract with a neat twist. The bridges really keep this game from being boring.

item.name: Poo: The Card Game
item.comment:
Poo is an extremely silly card game. It's also very light and mostly devoid of any sort of actual tactics. However, it is full of monkey feces jokes which, if you're willing to get into toilet humor, can provide quite a lot of laughs.
Poo plays up to 8 and it's quick so I think it would make a good game for big groups looking for something light, fast and fun. This one won't make you think, but it will likely make you laugh.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics in February 2011.

item.name: POOP: The Game
item.comment: Light and silly. A perfect game for my lunch group.

item.name: Popular Front
item.comment: A really interesting little wargame that's almost more of a hand management exercise. That's not a bad thing! This could be superb gateway to more complex wargames for casual gamers. I love the simplified point-to-point movement as well as the easy terrain rules. I also really like that both players have the same deck so it comes down to management.

item.name: Portobello Market
item.comment:
Purchased 8/30/07
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment:
Power Grid is exactly what a long Eurogame should be. The turns go relatively quickly yet there is a ton to think about. It's mostly about maximizing your money and most games are close. It's not to hard to teach or play so it makes a good introduction to heavy Euros.
Previously owned. Repurchased from Josh Look on 4/26/12.

item.name: Power Grid: China/Korea
item.comment: This map felt incredibly balanced and also really tight. I loved the split markets as that really factored in to the power plant decisions. An awesome expansion map that I look forward to playing again.

item.name: Power Grid: Factory Manager
item.comment:
Oh dear God, this is the most tediously unfun game I've ever played. It's the dryest optimization game I've ever seen. There are a lot of choices, of that I have no doubt. However, the game is just a chore to play. It really feels like work. When I play a game, I need to care about something I'm doing. In this case, I hoped that my factory would burn to the ground in a firey disaster.
I rate this game a 2 because I will [b][u]NEVER[/u][/b] play this again under any circumstances. It's not a 1 because its a solid design. I'd rather sit and watch Beaches instead of playing it though.

item.name: Powerboats
item.comment:
A fun little race game with great use of dice. There's a lot of risk in this game, but managing that risk is what seperates good drivers from bad ones. Luck may affect the outcome sometimes, but this one is good fun regardless. A great game to play with families.
Purchased 5/12/09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Praetor
item.comment:
Brilliant worker-placement game. I love how you own tiles in the city and have to pay other players to use their. Best of all is the use of dice as workers so they gain experience and get better at their job. Once they get too good, they retire. And then you have to pay them pensions!
This game works great for 2. If it's even just as good with more then I will raise this rating.

item.name: The Princess Bride: Storming the Castle
item.comment: 100% luck, a bit of take that, and wretched components make a game that only hardcore fans of the movie could love.

item.name: Progress: Evolution of Technology
item.comment: Multi-player solitaire done perfectly. This game is all about the tech-tree. It's distilled down to it's basics and that's perfect for this game.

item.name: Prolix
item.comment:
Preliminary rating based on one 2-player game. The 2-player game felt a bit lacking but I think playing with a proper player number should be great.
Need to play with other player counts to develop complete opinion in order to write a proper review.
Received a review copy from the designer in September 2010
Traded in March 2011

item.name: Puzzle Strike
item.comment:
A Dominion clone with a neat way to control victory. The Gem pile is a neat concept, but I'm not sure how it fits into the game. It feels a bit tacked on.
I like this and I'd play it again, but does it really offer anything different?
Traded in September 2011 Almost-instant Gratification Math Trade.

item.name: Quantum
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Quarriors!
item.comment:
Dominion invented the genre of deckbuilding and many others have taken the idea and twisted it. I've played almost all of them, but none of them are as much fun as Quarriors. This game is pure fun. There's not a lot of meaningful decisions, but there are lots of decisions. It seems like a lot of the dice are about the same power level which means that they'll all be generally useful. This avoids one of my big problems with Dominion.
I'm really looking forward to more plays of Quarriors. I've started my rating at 7, but I think this will go up a lot. I'm trying to be cautious with this one because I love the fun factor. I don't want to set myself up for failure with this one.
Purchased from CSI 8/16/11

item.name: Quarriors! Rise of the Demons
item.comment:
This is a great expansion to a really fun game. The corrupted Quiddity are terrific and it really adds a lot to the game. I love the new card interactions. It should really have been in the base game which would have made the game way better from day 1.
A Christmas gift from my awesome wife, 2011.

item.name: Quarto!
item.comment: This game couldn't be simpler. You place pieces trying to get 4 in a row with the same attribute. But there's a bunch of different attributes so it gets really hard to remember them all and keep an eye on what is going on. I think a nice copy of this would make a great coffee table piece.

item.name: Queen's Necklace
item.comment: This is a fun little card game that mixes set collection with some blind-bidding based on memory. It moves quick and is easy to explain. There's a lot of room for subtle tactics here which gives the game some depth. I love the way of tracking the cards to lower their values. It works really well.

item.name: Queen's Ransom
item.comment:
A nice little deduction game which is a bit light on the actual deduction. You collect cards and buy your clues. You then have to remember what's what to solve the crime. There are some nice cards to mess up the memory aspect and a few ways to block/bluff opponents. The game plays pretty quickly so it makes a nice filler.
Purchased as the WBC August 7, 2010

item.name: Quietville
item.comment: Average, at best. This one is okay, but I'm not crazy about it. There's a lot of luck here and even the best strategies will be undone by it.

item.name: Qwirkle
item.comment: Purchased 4/3/08

item.name: Qwitch
item.comment:
Take the chaos of Blink, but add in multiple players. Then make the game harder by using multiple sets of information which makes it that much harder to play cards.
Sound like fun? Nope.

item.name: R-Eco
item.comment: This is one of my absolute favorite card games. Very simple rules and fast gameplay make this a great introductory game. Ideal with 3 or 4.

item.name: Ra
item.comment:
Ra is the undisputed king of the simple auction game. There's really not much to the rules here, yet this luck-pushing game of chicken really makes you question every action you take. The resources are tight and you almost need to play the other players as opposed to playing the game.
This is a solid 9. I can't rate it a 10 because I don't get to play with anyone besides my family. I need to play this outside my normal group and then I think it could be a 10.
Purchased 10/19/07

item.name: Ra: The Dice Game
item.comment:
Purchased from Game Surplus 8/14/09
This game is a 7 if I'm playing with 4 players and probably about an 8.5 for a 2-player game. The speed of the 2-player game is awesome.
*********EDIT*********
I've bumped up to a 10. I love this game with any number of players. It's quick and violent with 2 players and changes a lot as the player number grows. The game becomes strategic and the focus changes to long term planning. It works great with any number of players and generally plays pretty quickly. I love this game.

item.name: Race Day
item.comment:
Let's face it, the cars are so cool. I love how they come in a card and you put them together and race. The concept is really awesome.
The game itself actually plays really well. I like all the optional rules for drafting, contact, spinning, and getting "in the marbles". This is a great little game that I'd definitely recommend if you can find it cheap.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment:
Purchased 11/4/08 Hated this my first time through. But I liked it a lot more on the second chance. Unfortunately Bianca doesn't like this one so I'll probably never own it. But now at least I feel comfortable enough to play if someone asks me to.
EDIT***************** I've been wrong before. Bianca has learned Race and is starting to enjoy it. Watching her grasp the ideas behind the game makes me even happier than playing it.
I've also upped the rating to 8. I'm really loving this game. I wish I got to play it more than I do, but its really gaining favor in my book.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
item.comment: Purchased 7/10/09

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: I loved the new goals and the player interaction/competition they add to the game. In my opinion, its worth owning this expansion just for that. I've heard good things about the solitaire mode so I may have to get the original and the expansion just to play it solitaire.

item.name: Rage
item.comment:
A mediocre trick-taking game which is more luck than I'd care to have in a trick-taker. It's not terrible, but there are a bunch of special cards which screw things up unnecessarily. I'd take most any trick-taker over this one.
That said, everyone should buy a Rage deck. Why? Because you can literally play about 25 games with it. For $5 that's one hell of a deal.

item.name: Railways of the World
item.comment:
Christmas Present - 2007
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009. Who needs this when you've got Age of Steam?

item.name: Rapa Nui
item.comment:
THis was a really cool and quite difficult card game. Very simple rules, but a lot of choices to make. The way scoring happens is brilliant. It says it's for 2-4, but 2 was awesome and 3 seems to be the limit due to chaos.
I'd really like to get my hands on this one.
Purchased from Game Surplus on 6/3/12

item.name: Rattus
item.comment:
There's a lot of chaos here. Rattus is full of unpredictability, but it's short enough and light enough that it's not a problem 45-60 minutes for a full compliment of 4 players and you're done.
I'll play this one if asked, but I doubt I'll request it. I'm glad I got to play it before buying because I took it off my wishlist.

item.name: Red November
item.comment:
Christmas Present 2008
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Reef Encounter
item.comment: If someone finds a brain on the floor, its mine. It melted out of my ear whilst playing Reef Encounter. Good golly this game is incredibly difficult to play well. Thats why I'm liking it so much. The rules are not that hard, but the game play is mind-bending. I'm not sure where Richard Breese came up with the actual mechanics, but I'm in awe. This is exactly what a heavy Euro should be.

item.name: Relationship Tightrope
item.comment:
Despite the horrendous theme and even worse illustrations, this is a great little trick-taking game. There are several ways to play it which makes it even more entertaining. It's probably best with 3 or 4 as you have more control, but I'd play with 5 because I like it so much.
The rating takes a small hit for the graphics. I'm looking forward to the new Yin-Yang version as that will make it much more attractive.
Purchased from FLGS in 2008

item.name: Relic
item.comment: Talisman: 40K! After my first play, I like Talisman more due to simplicity. We'll see how that holds up.

item.name: Relic: Nemesis
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game
item.comment:
This is a great deck-building game which builds on the foundation of Dominion. I think this is the first game that takes the brilliant Dominion mechanism and puts it in an actual game. My wife and I really enjoyed our first game and we give it a 7/10 to start. We'll see how it goes from there.
Christmas Present 2010 from my wife.
Sold in my WBC aution 7/11

item.name: The Resistance
item.comment:
Much, much better than Werewolf. This is a simple deduction game in which players have very little information available and even less time to figure it out. It's really easy to play and would make a great party game due to it's large player count (5-10). Definitely worth having in your collection for all those times you have too many players.
Purchased from CSI 5/12/2011.
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Revolution!
item.comment:
Easily the best game that SJG has ever put out. This one feels like 12 blind-bid auctions happening at one time except table-talk is encouraged to create some bargains/backstabbing. The 3 different currencies work perfectly.
I do feel that the game is a bit too easy. I don't like how you always have 5 pieces of currency to use. I'm thinking that this one will be much better with the 5-6 player expansion as that will really crowd things up a bit and make you work harder to get what you want.

item.name: Risk
item.comment: So long, and so unrewarding. The best way to play Risk is to give each player 100 six-sided dice and have them roll them. The player with the most 6's wins. That will save you from the countless hours of boredom created by Risk.

item.name: Risk 2210 A.D.
item.comment:
Hands down the best Risk I've played yet. We got through a 4-player game in about 2 hours. It was tense and strategic which is not something I can say about any other Risk version.
If this game did not have Risk on the cover, I expect it would be rated much higher.

item.name: Risk Express
item.comment:
English import - August 2008 - Steph and Charlotte
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: The Rivals for Catan
item.comment:
This game is pure vanilla. It does the job and it does it well enough, but there's just nothing to be excited about here. I don't see how you can really have any player interaction with some minor exceptions.
I'll play it, but why bother? Holy boring, Batman.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics on 10/21/2011

item.name: The Road to Canterbury
item.comment: A solid area majority game with some hand management. Id like to play it again to explore some of the strategies.

item.name: Robber Knights
item.comment:
Dorn's take on mancala. We thought this one had some interesting decisions to make and I'm thinking we'll try it again. I feel like there's something more than what we saw in our first play.
Received in the WBC No-Ship Math Trade - August 2011
Sold in my Fall auction 2011.

item.name: Robotory
item.comment:
Boooooooring. Not a good game. There's no real game here. I can play a game of TAMSK or TZAAR in the same amount of time and get a far superior gaming experience.
Purchased from Boulder Games 12/23/09 Traded away in Math Trade 2010

item.name: Rock!
item.comment:
A very simple card game in which both players simultaneously play a card. Each card has rock, paper, or scissors. Whoever calls out the winner of the pair wins the cards. Most cards at the end wins.
Yup, it's that simple. A great game for kids.

item.name: Rococo
item.comment:
This game is pure Euro which is usually a turn off for me recently. However, I do love the theme of this one which is what got me interested.
I really love the small card deck you start off with that grows but is always manageable. Picking your workers each turn is so much better than the blind draw of a game like Dominion. There's an engine here, but it's reigned in each turn.
We play 2-player and it works amazingly well. I love the tightness which is natural from a Euro.

item.name: Roll for the Galaxy: Ambition
item.comment: Absolutely necessary to complete the game. This is the kind of variety the starting tiles needed. I also love the goals. This is just as great an addition as the first expansion was for Race for the Galaxy.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment: My wife and I enjoyed this game quite a bit. There is definitely some strategy to it, but overall it comes down to luck as do all dice games. I feel this one is drastically improved by having more players as you start to require different Developments.

item.name: Rorschach
item.comment:
Purchased from Bouldergames.com on 9/21/09
The rating for this game is based on the fact that as its boxed, there's no game there. But we're going to make one and its going to rock.

item.name: Rosenk√∂nig
item.comment: One play of this game has left me questiong whether I like it or not. I'm just not sure. I need to play it a few more times. For now I rate it a 6 because I find it a bit dry.

item.name: Royal Palace
item.comment:
Sort of a worker-placement game, but with some twists. Some workers stay, others come and go. You start with a lot of workers and it dwindles down, changing the game significantly.
Purchased from FLGS - May 2009
Traded away in the Labor of Love Math Trade.
Reacquired at Origins 2015

item.name: Royal Turf
item.comment:
Winner's Circle is a horse-racing/gambling game done right. It's very easy to teach and play and has a healthy dose of luck mixed with some strategy. Sometimes the best move is to hurt your opponents instead of helping yourself.
This is surely not the prettiest game around.
Trade with Marvinrah - unsure of date

item.name: Rumis
item.comment: 6 is a perfect description for me for Rumis. I don't really like this one too much, but Bianca does so I'm sure it will get played.

item.name: Rummikub
item.comment: Gift from Bianca's mom - 2008

item.name: Run Wild
item.comment: This game is a mix between rummy and Nertz, but not as good as either of those. It's really nice to look at due to the great colors on the cards, but I'd rather play either of the aforementioned games instead.

item.name: Run, Fight, or Die!
item.comment:
Pros: I love dice rolling and zombies Tons of cards for a lot of variety in gameplay Minis are amazing Plays pretty quick
Cons: Plays quick because it's insanely difficult and people will die quickly Multiplayer solitaire for the most part
