I'll play it anytime someone who owns it wants to, but I don't feel like I need to buy this one.

item.name: S'quarrels: A Game of Absolute Nuts
item.comment:
A very random and chaotic set collection game. It's quick and harmless and also fun enough to play occassionally. It's more like a time filler than a game, but it's not too bad. Plus, it's got squirrels!
Purchased from www.coolstuffinc.com on 2/18/10. Sold sometime thereafter.

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment:
Saboteur is a great secret role game. It's very quick and works well with almost any number of players, although I've not played with more than 6 which I imagine gets a bit busy. You get all the paranoia and tension of a game like BSG in about 10% of the time.
For $10, its quite hard to beat. Plus, it's easy enough that kids can play.
Purchased 7/10/09

item.name: Saint Malo
item.comment: It's good enough. Nothing amazing, and some strategies are clearly best (build walls!).

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment:
The DRIEST game ever. I'm an accountant and this feels like accounting to me. There's no theme and no fun. It's pure number crunching with cards. There's one card which I can't exactly call that is outright broken.
This is a great game mechanism. Somebody just needs to put a fun game around this great engine.

item.name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches
item.comment:
This is a brilliant little game that is basically a train game in disguise. Instead of buying shares, you marry into families. Consider this a family version of Chicago Express. Really quite good and great for 2 players.
Purchased from CSI April 2010.

item.name: Samurai: The Card Game
item.comment:
Ugh. Booooooooooring. Play a card, draw a card. The Samurai cards are way too powerful. I suppose I might be willing to give this a go again sometime, but I can't see why I should. It just doesn't feel like there's any real choices to make in the game.
Christmas present 2009
Traded away in Math Trade 2010

item.name: San Juan (second edition)
item.comment: Just like the first version, but better.

item.name: Say Anything
item.comment:
Just like Apples to Apples in that it's a "play the judge" game. Who cares if your answer is right by group consensus, just play what the judge will like. It's a bit flawed in that regard. Also, the scoring mechanics are a bit convoluted and not as straightforward as A2A.
Dom is a great guy, but this isn't one I want to play again.

item.name: Schotten-Totten
item.comment:
I think I actually like this game better than Battle Line because it's incredibly difficult. The gameplay is almost identical, but the lack of the 10's makes this game very tough.
Don't buy this one though. Buy Battle Line as you can play both games then.

item.name: Scrabble
item.comment: The grandfather of word games. It's okay, but I don't love word games. You also need to be on the same level as your opponent or it will be very lopsided.

item.name: Scrabble Express
item.comment: A really bad version of Scrabble. The idea is right, but it's just so damn clunky and not fun.

item.name: Scrabble Slam!
item.comment:
Right idea, wrong execution. 4 letter words are easy, but the game constantly falls into a loop where all you can do is change one letter and then you're stuck due to the luck of the cards.
They were close on this one, but ultimately it's a failure.

item.name: Scriptorium
item.comment:
This is one of the best games I have ever played. Very rarely does a game impress me enough to get multiple plays right out of the box, but we played this 5 times the first day. Unbelievably good game and really high quality for a self-published affair.
UPDATE - I increased my rating to a 10 on 2-9-08. I love this game and I find myself constantly wanting to play it. A glowing review will be coming soon.

item.name: Scripts and Scribes: The Dice Game
item.comment:
S&S Dice takes the game you know and love and nicely converts it into a dice game. There are tons of choices here. I'm not crazy about the auction for resources, but that may just be because it was a 2-player game. I need more plays of this before I start rating.
Received a copy from the designer for review. 7/6/12

item.name: Seeland
item.comment:
Some designers just click with you on so many levels. For my family, that designer is Gunther Burkhardt. We've enjoyed a good many of his games and the newest favorite from him (and co-designer Wolfgang Kramer) is Seeland.
What makes this game so good? Simple rules and tough choices. I'll tell you right now, skip the basic game. It's too easy and isn't fun. Go right for the full Monty and you'll see just how beautiful this design is.
Warning: You've got to play like a jerk to do well. Being nice will result in a good game, but not a great one. The nastiness is necessary because blocking your opponents is often a key move.
A birthday gift from my wife 5/4/11

item.name: Seii Taishogun
item.comment: A nice little area majority game that refused to end. I think the designer fixed this issue with a small tweak in the rules and if so, I'd recommend you play it. Otherwise, it's broken.

item.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse
item.comment:
Sentinels seemed like a great idea, and then we started playing it. Boooooooooooooring. Some of the decks literally did nothing. There were too many duplicate cards and it didn't really go anywhere. A completely boring take on co-ops which is a shame because the idea is awesome.
I'm not convinced we didn't do something wrong so I'm willing to try it again, but I'm not sure I'm in much of a hurry.

item.name: SET
item.comment:
Purchased from FLGS - 2007
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Shadow Hunters
item.comment:
Shadow Hunters is pure fun. Very simple rules, huge amounts of interaction. This game is a social experience every time I play it. There's always tension as you try to find out who is who. Lots of violence and back-stabbity goodness.
Purchased from CSI in late April 2010

item.name: Shadow Hunters Expansion Kit
item.comment:
Horrendously overpriced, but really worth it for the added depth.
Purchased from CSI in late April 2010

item.name: Shanghaien
item.comment:
Purchased 10/28/09
This is a great little dice rolling game for 2 people. It's like a worker placement game with variable workers. The scoring mechanic is awesome.
Traded in October 2010 for Days of Steam.

item.name: Shark
item.comment:
A completely random stock market game. If not for the fact that this game has a vicious streak a mile wide it wouldn't be worth playing. That nastiness makes it somewhat enjoyable.
Received in Math Trade 05/2011
Traded away in my Short and Sweet Math Trade - August 2011

item.name: Shootin' Ladders: Frag Fest
item.comment:
A very simple and random game of blowing up gingerbread men. This game is all about the fun and is not to be taken seriously. I like the variety of scenarios as that will give a lot of replayability to this game.
It's fun and entertaining, but not as awesome as I'd hoped it would be.
Acquired via trade in the Almost-instant Gratification Math Trade.
Traded away in May 2012.

item.name: Sixis
item.comment: Yuck. I'd rather play yahtzee or almost any other dice game instead. If you want one that's more fun, look at Easy Come, Easy Go or Yahtzee Free for All. Just please don't play this.

item.name: Skull
item.comment: A fine bluffing game. This is a great way to start a night. You need to be aggressive and this will get you in that mindset.

item.name: Slide 5
item.comment: A very light blind-bidding type game. Don't play with more than 4 or all Hell will break loose. You don't have much control in this game, but that's okay because it's a filler, not a main event. I'd play if asked, but I'm in no hurry.

item.name: Slush Fund
item.comment:
Kind of like 4-way Battle Line. The game works well enough although compared to Scripts & Scribes this is unimpressive. I liked the concept of the game and how the special cards mixed things up a bit, but overall this was a pass from us.
Not bad, but not good either.

item.name: Small World
item.comment:
Purchased 4/27/09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Small World Underground
item.comment: Very much more fiddly than the base game. I will get rid of this and go for the original.

item.name: Smash Up
item.comment: Multi-player Battle Line with different player abilities. I love the different factions and how they interact. I can't wait to try the expansions.

item.name: Sneaks & Snitches
item.comment:
This is a great game of double guess and outthinking the competition. Very easy rules, but great gameplay make this a winner. You can play in less than 20 minutes once you get the hang of things so you'll likely end up playing multiple games in a row.
Loses a couple points for being too light but it's a great game for non-gamers or when you just want something simple.
A birthday gift from my buddy Geof.

item.name: Snow Tails
item.comment:
This game has AMAZING mechanics. The way the sleds move is truly brilliant. I love the dent cards and how they reduce your options. That said, I didn't love the gameplay. I was hoping for something a bit faster, with a bit more tension and harshness to your decisions. It's a really awesome game and I can see why it's rated so high, but it just doesn't click for me.
Purchased at Time Warp Comics on 4/22/12

item.name: Sobek
item.comment:
A simple set-collection game with the joy of a corruption mechanic. Very easy to play, some mildly interesting choices. Not overwhelmingly great, but not terrible.
Received in July 2012 Math Trade

item.name: Sons of Anarchy: Men of Mayhem
Sopio
item.comment: Imagine if Fluxx moved quickly and was a bit less random....that's Sopio. I like short wacky games so I don't mind this. I'd choose it over Fluxx every single time.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment:
Purchased at Toys R Us - Summer 2008
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Space Alert
item.comment:
Oh God, what a nightmare. Take a whole lot of rules, fiddly pieces, annoying programming of actions, and an annoying CD and what do you have? Space Alert!
I'm definitely in the minority on this, but I can't stand this. Our one try felt like a lot of work with no reward in sight. I fail to see where the fun is in this one.

item.name: Space Hulk (third edition)
item.comment: Purchased direct from GW 8/28/09

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel ‚Äì The Card Game
item.comment:
Its amazing how well this game works. I think it's actually better than it's predecessor. Wonderful game system makes for a lot of tension. Some fun choices and not too many rules make this a great choice. Solitaire works great as well.
F:AT Secret Satan 2010 and again in 2014.
Sold in my game auction 6/2011.

item.name: Space Sheep!
item.comment: Real-time cooperative puzzle game? CHECK!

item.name: Spades
item.comment:
The purest trick-taking game I've ever played and likely the best. The simplicity here is brilliant. I love how the teamwork makes you really think about your choices even more than in Hearts where you play alone.
If you've got 4 people and a deck of cards, you should be playing Spades.

item.name: Spectaculum
item.comment: This was fine. Nothing special. It's sort of a stock game with route building, but too close to zero sum for my liking.

item.name: The Speicherstadt
item.comment:
The Speicherstadt has one of the nastiest bidding mechanisms I've ever seen and I think it's pure genius. In typical Feld fashion, you never have enough of what you need and the bid mechanism preys on that vulnerability.
The game plays quickly and yet offers an incredible amount of depth and decision making. A perfect game for 4 players with about 75 minutes looking for a nasty pseudo-auction/worker placement game.
Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: The Spoils
item.comment: I played this pre-BGG and really disliked it. I'm not sure why, but it didn't work for me at all. It seemed like a poor Magic clone.

item.name: Spring Fever
item.comment: A simple card-based Liar's Dice variant. There's not much game here, but it would be a good ice breaker for new gamers or a small party. It's good for a few laughs.

item.name: Star Trek: Fleet Captains
item.comment:
This game is a Trekkie's dream come true. It's super-thematic and really tells a great story. The ships are really awesome and the Clix base works perfectly for this game. This is everything you could want in a Star Trek game.
On the other hand, I think it's a bit fiddly and there's a bit more downtime than I'd like, but that may just be because it was our first game.
I really don't think this is worth the $100 MSRP they're asking and it's barely worth the $70 you can get it for online. If this was selling for $50 it would be awesome. The non-ship components should be MUCH better for the price you're paying.

item.name: Star Wars Customizable Card Game
item.comment:
This CCG started out incredible but rules kept being added and it got a bit messy. However, the mechanisms work perfectly and create a really great game.
I wish I had someone to play this with.

item.name: Star Wars: The Queen's Gambit
item.comment:
The Queen's Gambit is the very definition of Ameritrash. It drips with theme, has a lot of luck and even more plastic pieces, and it's completely immersive. The way things are woven together really ties the theme into the gameplay. I love the 3 story palace board despite that fact that it makes it a bitch to move guys.
There's a reason this is so expensive. It's a modern classic that provides an awesome experience. I am a lucky man to own a copy.
Wedding Present 4/5/09

item.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game
item.comment: I love so much about this game. The only complaint is how the end drags. It's still worth it for the quality of the the rest of it.

item.name: The Stars Are Right
item.comment:
Purchased from Bouldergames.com on 9/21/09
This one looks fun. Lets hope its as good as it looks.
Holy crap this game is hard! Total brain burner. But its really good fun in about 45 minutes. My wife likes this one so it gets a bump up in my book.

item.name: Steel Driver
item.comment: Wallace's version of Chicago Express is very nicely streamlined. I love the bidding cubes instead of using your money. It makes the game much cleaner. I also like the endgame which is really critical to determining a winner. It has such a huge impact on scoring.

item.name: Sticheln
item.comment:
Sticheln is a trick-taking game that turns all the rules of trick-taking on their head. I liked the game once I was able to unprogram myself from usual trick-taking rules. The game is playable with a Rage deck (as are many other great games) and the rules are available here on the Geek. If you like trick-taking games then I recommend you try this one. It's not the best of the bunch, but it's different and pretty enjoyable.
My first experience with this game took FOREVER which is a problem I have with lots of trick-taking games.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment:
Stone Age is a nice worker placement game that ha a lot of luck built into it. It's pretty light but is definitely family friendly. Works great for 2, 3, or 4 players.
My wife likes this game because of the luck factor. She likes to take chances when she has spare meeples because she likes the gamble.

item.name: Stratego
item.comment:
A true classic that I actually don't mind playing. It's very simple, but the game is full of bluff/counter-bluff. Lots of second guessing and tension.
How can such an old game still have legs?

item.name: Straw
item.comment:
This game is a bit too simple for adults to play because there's not a lot of strategy but I think it would work okay for kids as a great math exercise.
Otherwise, there are no decisions in this game at all.
Purchased from www.coolstuffinc.com on 12/30/09

item.name: String Safari
item.comment: This is a perfect game for 7-10 year old. So many skills to learn here: dexterity, simple math, pattern recognition, strategy and tactics. It's amazing for kids and still fun for adults.

item.name: Strozzi
item.comment:
Birthday present - May 2009
Traded for Masons 9/4/09

item.name: SuDoku: Das Kartenspiel
item.comment: Purchased at 2007 WBC

item.name: Summoner Wars
item.comment:
First play was awesome. Fast and furious. Luck is a big factor, but it doesn't control the whole game. Knowing your deck is a huge plus.
Purchased from CSI in February 2010

item.name: Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
item.comment:
This is a pretty awesome game. Rules are simple, but it's got lots of head to head combat. I need more plays to flesh out my opinion but I do like the card management quite a bit.
Purchased at Time Warp Comics on 4/22/12

item.name: Sun Tzu
item.comment:
Purchased 6/10/09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Sunrise City
item.comment: Purchased at RIW Hobbies on 7/5/12

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!
item.comment:
What a fun game, if you can call it that. There's not a lot of game here but there is a whole lot of fun. This game drips theme and the new Stronghold version is just beautiful. I'm really glad I own this and look forward to lots more plays.
Edit 8/15/11 - I upped my rating to a 9. This game is brilliant. I want to play this game a lot. It's so perfect for an hour-long light strategy game.
Purchased from Game Surplus 2/25/2011

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! 5-6 Player Mini Expansion
item.comment: Purchased from Stronghold Games at the WBC August 7, 2011.

item.name: Survive: Escape from Atlantis! The Giant Squid Mini Expansion
item.comment: Purchased from Game Surplus 2/25/2011

item.name: Sushizock im Gockelwok
item.comment: Purchased 10/9/08

item.name: Swap!
item.comment: This makes Uno seem intellectual. That's all I need to say about that.

item.name: SWAT!
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Taboo
item.comment:
A truly hilarious party game. Like all games in this genre, its fun for a short while and then overstays it's welcome. Still, Taboo is high on my list of party games and is quite enjoyable with the right crowd.
Limit your games to an hour and you'll be fine.

item.name: Take it Easy!
item.comment: Purchased 8/12/08 Sold in my game auction September 2009

item.name: Take Stock
item.comment:
Only one play with 2 so far, but I really like this game. It's got tough choices but simple rules. It plays fast and is easy to teach. One of the great aspects of this game is that you have to watch the discard pile and pay attention to what's going in there.
The big downside to this game is that the Market cards can be wildly unpredictable. I suppose this matches the unpredictability of the stock market well, but it makes the game a bit lighter than I'd like.
Purchased from Tanga in July 2011 for free!
Traded in the July Math Trade.

item.name: Take the Train
item.comment: Terrible. This game is all luck and no skill. The rules are terrible and it's no fun to play. There are literally 200 games I'd rather play first. I don't care if this is just a short filler, it's still garbage.

item.name: Takenoko
item.comment:
A light family game with some nice decisions to be made. Lots of press your luck. It's a more complicated TTR that's also better in every way.
Purchased at Time Warp Comics in May/June 2012.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: My rating is reflective of playing the game to full length. It just takes too damn long. If you set a 90 minute time limit on this one, I'd rate it a 7. I love the gameplay, but it just drags towards the end of the game.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Highland Expansion
item.comment:
Not as impressed with this big box expansion as The Reaper, but it's cool to add the Highlands area to the board. There's a lot of big nasties up there which is always fun. You need to have some power before you go in there or you can get ground down pretty quickly. The Relics can be worth the trouble so it's definitely worth doing. The alternate endings are cool as well, plus you get 5 new characters which is nice for replay purposes.
Purchased for my wife's birthday on 3/26/12.

item.name: Talisman (fourth edition): The Reaper Expansion
item.comment:
An absolute MUST HAVE for Talisman fans. It adds a huge amount of adventure cards, spell cards and of course The REAPER.
Want to make Talisman completely awesome? Just add the Reaper.

item.name: Talisman (Revised 4th Edition)
item.comment:
This is a solid 8 for me, maybe a 9 if it plays well with 2. Super simple game, yet lots of fun. I love the PvP aspect. This is just a blast. If you play it quickly you can finish a 4-player game in 2 hours. Endless variety and tons of good times.
**********EDIT************
I had this at an 8 and then I played it again. It's a 10 for sure. I can't imagine not wanting to play it. It's really just a perfect game for what I want.
Purchased at Time Warp Comics 03/16/2012.

item.name: Tally Ho!
item.comment: A very simple game that is kind of fun to play on occassion. Luck plays a HUGE factor in this one because you can very easily lose your most valuable pieces in the first turn or two.

item.name: Taluva
item.comment: Purchased 7/17/09

item.name: Tammany Hall
item.comment: Very simple rules, agonizing choices. This game was HARD, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. Brilliant mechanisms combine for a stellar gameplay experience. I want to play this again right now.

item.name: TAMSK
item.comment:
What a wonderful little game! It's a very simple design in which you try to trap your opponents pieces and it works perfectly like that. The real trick is that the pieces are sand timers so you are really under the gun to not waste time or have your pieces get stuck. This game would sell a ton if it was available in big stores.
I can't believe this one was removed from the GIPF project. It's terrific.
Purchased 1/23/08

item.name: Tank on Tank
item.comment:
LnL has a great idea here with this game as an introductory wargame or something to play over lunch. However, the execution is not there. The game is too simple and simply evolves into a slugfest every time. The "scenarios" are just a bunch of different units that enter from opposite sides of the map and meet in the middle. I wanted a simple wargame, but not one that was completely neutered.
Purchased from CSI in April 2010

item.name: Telestrations
item.comment: Eat poop you cat, only with great dry erase booklets.

item.name: Tempt Destiny
item.comment: Review copy received Fall 2007

item.name: Terror in Meeple City
item.comment: Awesome dexterity game. The rulebook sucks. Too many loopholes that could have very easily been answered.

item.name: Tetris Link
item.comment:
This is one of the best looking games I've played in a while. Unfortunately, it's a very simple abstract that is simply too easy to play with less than 4 players. Given my choice, I'd play Blokus anytime.
My wife played it with 2 and said it's horrible because you literally can't stop the other player from doing anything.
On the other hand...There's now a 2-player version that's quite awesome.
Purchased for my wife for Christmas 2011.

item.name: Thebes
item.comment:
I still can't figure out why I don't own this. Such a fun game. There's a ton of luck in this one, but I love how the time factor is tied so closely to the mechanics. It's really quite awesome.
This is a great family game that almost anyone can play and enjoy. I really should try to acquire this one.

item.name: The Thief of Baghdad
item.comment: This one felt completely vanilla to me. It was okay, but I don't remember enough to have a positive impression which can't be a good thing. I remember playing it but not being overly impressed.

item.name: This Town Ain't Big Enough for the 2-4 of Us
item.comment: First play with no micro-expansions was great. Can't wait to play more with adding some of those in. I think this little game has a ton of potential.

item.name: Three-Dragon Ante
item.comment: A trick-taking game with way too much text on the cards and a few too many rules. It's a decent idea that falls short. Sometimes less is more.

item.name: Through the Desert
item.comment:
Purchased at 2007 WBC
Sold in my WBC aution 7/11

item.name: Thunderstone
item.comment:
I like the ideas behind Thunderstone. I like how everything is useful in different ways so cards aren't usually dead in your hand. I also really like the art and the idea of killing monsters in a dungeon. And that's where it stops.
You need so many different cards to do anything and the likelihood of getting them all in your hand is not good. So many times I had a lot of attack and no torches. Useless. Or I'd have low attack and torches, but none of my cards would be worth gold for the village. And then the monsters! Sometimes they are strong, sometimes weak. But then they may have rediculous conditions on how to kill them. I could go on, but I don't need to.
Great idea, bad execution. I'll never play this again. I don't even like Dominion anymore but I'd gladly play that over Thunderturd.
****************************EDIT*************************
I played it again and things were different this time. The starting monster pool was picked as a learning group and the cards available were tailored to the monsters. The idea was to give me an appreciation of the mechanics which was accomplished.
It's still not a favorite, but I'd play it if asked. I'll up my rating to a 6.5.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.comment:
Purchased at 2007 WBC
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Tichu
item.comment: A partnership climbing game that has a lot of things right. Unfortunately, some of the special cards are obtuse as are the bomb rules. I'm sure this is a good one once you work out the kinks, but I'd rather just play Spades if I have 4 people.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: Purchased 5/10/07

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 ‚Äì India & Switzerland
Ticket to Ride: M√§rklin
item.comment:
A great TTR variation which makes it a bit gamier. I love the passenger mechanism as it really introduces a nice scoring alternative without changing the game too much. I thought the tickets felt balance and the board was tight.
I'd definitely play this over the original if I had a choice.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
item.comment: Purchased 6/18/08

item.name: Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment:
Purchased 5/23/07
I rate this the same as TTR because as far as I'm concerned, you NEED to have this if you own TTR. Makes the game much better.

item.name: Tides of Time
item.comment: Provisional rating - need more plays

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Tikal
item.comment:
I've tried a lot of Kramer/Kiesling games and one thing is consistent for me: I just don't like them. I don't know if they are just too dry for me or what, but I don't really care for them. They work fine as a design, but I'm just not interested in the gameplay.
That said, Tikal was tolerable enough. I'd play it again, but I'm not eager to. I've played much worse.

item.name: Time's Up! Title Recall!
item.comment:
I should rate this a 1.... Where's the game? They should just call this one "Guess what this crap is?". Its a more fitting title. Absolutely horrendous.
I'm still searching for a party game that isn't Wits & Wagers that doesn't suck.

item.name: Timeline: Inventions
item.comment: Not really much of a game but it works fine as a short filler with an educational purpose.

item.name: Times Square
item.comment: A Knizia tug of war game with some interesting twists. The emphasis is on hand management but I think luck could play a big factor as well.

item.name: Tin Soldiers
item.comment: Purchased Early July 2009

item.name: Tis The Season: Christmas Trivia
item.comment: Ugh. Not a very good game at all. No real "game" at all. Just try to answer more questions right than the other team. However, I'll probably end up playing this on Christmas for the rest of my life.

item.name: To Court the King
item.comment:
New, IN SHRINK!
This is a nice mix of dice-rolling and card play to manipulate the dice. Unfortunately it's very 1-dimensional. The game basically boils down to a race and bad luck will absolutely kill you.
This was pretty good when it came out, but it's been far surpassed by newer dice games.

item.name: Tobago
item.comment:
Purchased from Coolstuffinc.com on 10/28/09
First play ran long. I think that was just because we were learning how the game works. I really like the idea, but if that length continues, this won't get played. That is why I am rating this a 6 for now. I sincerely hope that was just our first game.
2nd game was even worse. I really dislike this game. It's fiddly, it's tedious, and the decisions are moot. This is not a good family game. Unless you hate your family.

item.name: Toss Up!
item.comment: A very simple push-your-luck dice game. Can be had for around $5 and works well enough to kill some time.

item.name: Tower of Babel
item.comment:
Tower of Babel was pretty solid, but not outstanding. It's got a great co-op mechanism that also rewards the players who get left out. The scoring design keeps things tight right to the very end.
I can't help but think that this would be so much more fun with a better theme and new graphics.

item.name: Trader
item.comment: Trader is a great little game with very simple rules. I like the choice between buying cards or selling cards. I think it really works nicely for two, but is likely better with 3 or even 4. I'd like to get this game as a quick filler.

item.name: Traders of Osaka
item.comment:
Purchased 4/27/09
Sold in my game auction Sept 2009
Reacquired in the summer of 2014. Looking to trade it away.
I'm sure I'm missing something because my opinion seems to be in the minority, but I just don't see what the fuss is about. I've owned it and tried it twice and It's just not fun.

item.name: Trambahn
item.comment: Brilliant two-player game that needs more plays.

item.name: Trias
item.comment:
I was expecting an entertaining game about dinosaurs. I was wrong. This was a boring abstract tile-movement game that didn't capture the dinosaur feel at all.
You want dinosaurs? Play Evo. That's the game you want.

item.name: Tribune: Primus Inter Pares
item.comment:
Tribune is without a doubt the leanest, meanest worker-placement game available. But to me, it seems to lack just a bit of fun and that's what I'm looking for in my games these days. A bit of luck or some crazy swings of fortune just aren't found in Tribune.
This is the "gamer's" worker-placement game.
Purchased 7/24/08

item.name: Triumvirate
item.comment:
This wasn't terrible, but I'm in no hurry to play it ever again. Trick-taking just doesn't work for two.
Purchased October 2009 from the designer.

item.name: Trouble
item.comment:
This is a terrible game. It's completely mindless and often you sit there doing nothing for long periods of time. But I tell you what, I have fun when I play this because it takes about 15 minutes and results in hilarity when played with my friends.
I don't recommend ANYONE buy this game. Just give everyone 10 d6's and roll them. Whoever rolls the most 6's wins. Saves time and money.

item.name: Troyes
item.comment:
Dear Xavier Georges,
Stop. Just stop. Stop adding in tons of rules and burying an otherwise fine game in ludicrous amounts of superfluous rules. Less is more, dear sir. Find a way to make something simple like Royal Palace again instead of games like Troyes or Carson City where you bury the essence in a pile of rules. It's not needed and while you may feel like you're being clever or proud of making a complex and deep game, all your doing is being complex for the sake of complexity. Again, less is more.
Thanks,
Stormseeker75

item.name: True Colors
item.comment: A fine party game where knowing the other players is good to win, but not knowing them leads to lots of learning about each other. An interest game I'd play again.

item.name: Trump, Tricks, Game!
item.comment:
This is without a doubt my favorite trick-taking game. I have yet to find a dominant strategy after 20-odd games. The gameplay is very tight and offers so many choices. The shifting trump suit is awesome.
If you like trick-taking games, buy this now.
Purchased 4/20/09

item.name: TSCHAK!
item.comment: Provisional rating - Needs more plays.

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment: Tsuro is about the easiest game I've ever played. I doubt there is any sort of strategy at all. Mostly the game is all about luck. But it's a fun game to play and it only takes about 5 minutes. Not a bad starter game for game nights.

item.name: Tumba
item.comment: The opposite of Jenga. Not a bad game. I do like how the game uses color to show where you need to match the pieces. Worthwhile if you can get it cheap.

item.name: Turbo Taxi
item.comment: Turbo Taxi is a good speed/puzzle game in which players solve a puzzle using tiles. It's easy to play, but it can't be tough to figure the puzzles. As each puzzle is created at game time, there's infinite replayability.

item.name: TZAAR
item.comment:
TZAAR is just like the other GIPF games: Easy rules, brain-bending choices. So many things to consider in a game that has about 4 sentences of rules. It's quick so you can get a couple games in 30 minutes.
Not my favorite in the series, but definitely a good game.

item.name: Ubongo
item.comment:
A very simple yet fun speed puzzle game. Each player has their own puzzle to complete. The first one done gets to move the farthest on the prize board. This makes it 2 games in one as you need to be careful what gems you take because you might make things better for your opponents.
Colorful, easy to teach, and fun. Ubongo is a great family/starter game. I'm looking forward to the expansion which will allow 2 more players.
Bought at Dark Tower games in approximately 2008.
My ex-wife got this one in the divorce.

item.name: Ubongo BMM
item.comment: Brought over from Germany by a friend 2009

item.name: Ubongo extrem
item.comment: Brought over by German friends - September 08

item.name: Ubongo: Das Duell
item.comment: Brought over from Germany by a friend 2009

item.name: Unpublished Prototype
item.comment: Working on my game

item.name: Unspeakable Words
item.comment: Sold in my game auction Sept 2009

item.name: Uptown
item.comment:
Uptown (or the newly named "Blockers") is a fine way to pass time, but it doesn't feel like much of a game. I'm not sure you have any control at all unless you play with less than 4 players. Unfortunately, that becomes boring as you have too much room to work. I'm not likely to recommend this one to many people because there's just nothing there.
That said, it gets a decent amount of plays by me because my family enjoys it. It's better than nothing, but not a game I'd ever suggest.
Purchased at All Things Fun - Summer 08

item.name: Urban Legends: The Game
item.comment: What an utter travesty of a game. Its actually fun for about 10 minutes. Unfortunately, the game insists on going on far beyond that. What an atrocity of roll-and-move combined with downright terrible art and components.

item.name: Urban Sprawl
item.comment:
An awesome boardgame implementation of Sim City. The rules to this game are actually surprisingly easy but there's a lot of depth to it and each decision really matters. The public offices make the game surprisingly interesting.
I need to play this more, but it was really impressive after my first play.
Purchased from doubtofbuddha in November 2011.
Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: Valley of the Kings
item.comment: Probably better at more than 2, but it felt a bit boring.

item.name: Vampire Empire
item.comment: We played this once and really didn't like it.

item.name: Vegas Showdown
item.comment:
Vegas Showdown is everything I love in a Eurogame. About 60 minutes to play, tough choices, good competition, and some great variety in tactics. Add to that a bit of randomness and a great theme and you have a real winner.
This game used to be readily available but I'm not sure now. If you can find it, buy it. It's almost perfect.

item.name: Vikings
item.comment: I find this game very vanilla. Its very easy to play, but I'm not sure if it grabs me. I'll play online anytime though because its fun enough that way. I'm sure I won't be owning this one.

item.name: Vom Kap bis Kairo
item.comment: A fun little card game that works well for 2. It's a bit simplistic, but it works. For under $9, it's hard to beat.

item.name: Waggle Dance
item.comment: Provisional rating - This needs more plays.

item.name: Walnut Grove
item.comment:
This is a great mix between Carc and Agricola that turns into a sort of puzzle game. It's really multi-player solitaire with some interaction on the central board, but it's definitely a "do your own thing" kind of game.
Great bits, interesting gameplay, and the right amount of time. If you're looking for Agricola Express then this is the game you want.
********EDIT***********
After my second game, I'm liking this one more and more. It's challenging. The requirements on feeding and heating your dudes is really tough. It seems like the farmer pieces may be straight up better than the laborers but I'm not sure.
******EDIT***************
Upped this to a 9. This is a masterful little game. It's light but there are lots of decisions to be made. the tile placement aspect is far more important than is first important. This is a great blend of mechanisms that plays awesome for 2 in 40 minutes. Good, good stuff.
Purchased from Thor @ www.gamesurplus.com on 1/24/12.

item.name: War of 1812
item.comment: Purchased 7/24/08

item.name: WarCraft: The Board Game
item.comment:
This felt like a Euro to me with a bit of fighting, right in line with Nexus Ops. The art in this game is great and the presentation is pretty good to boot.
If you like the RTS, then you will likely enjoy the boardgame version.

item.name: Warhammer 40,000: Battle for Macragge
item.comment:
This is a perfect introductory set for anyone looking to learn 40K. It has a good amount of minis, the scenarios teach the rules at a good pace, and the price is really good.
My rating comes from my total dislike of miniature games. I have no interest in using a ruler and referencing a book and fiddling with all type of minutae.

item.name: Warhammer: Invasion
item.comment:
I liked this game, but not enough to keep playing it. I'd rather play Magic or WoW:TCG any day. Magic theme decks do a much better job at creating a preset play environment than this box set does.
I got this back in a trade over the summer 2012. I'm not sure what I was thinking.

item.name: Warlord
item.comment:
Excellent miniature wargame. Easy rules to learn but allow for a lot of strategy. Best of all, data for each figure is listed on a card which can be downloaded for free from the manufacturer's website.
6/20/07 - Dropped the rating to a 7. I'm not into miniature games anymore.

item.name: Warriors of God
item.comment: I've played this twice now and I just think this is too fiddly. There's so much going on it takes away from what should normally be a simple ruleset. I'm not giving up on this one yet, but I'm certainly not enjoying it.

item.name: Was sticht?
item.comment: This is an overly complicated trick-taker with some novel concepts. The dual trumps are a real pain and make the game more complex than it needs to be. I also don't care for the drafting portion. It just felt too cumbersome for my tastes. I did enjoy the goal cards which put a lot of emphasis on the draft. I'd still prefer it to be done differently.

item.name: Wasabi!
item.comment:
This game is absolutely beautiful...to look at. To play it is another story. The rules are easy, but it comes down to having no choices and no control. All you can do is hope and pray that your pieces stay where you want them and nobody messes with your plan.
A very light game that may work for families. I'd recommend playing Ticket to Ride instead.

item.name: Washington's War
item.comment:
This is a great game. Lots of choices. How far and how hard to push? Reinforce? Move generals? Attack? Lots to consider.
I think this rating will go up with further plays.
Purchased from CSI March 2010

item.name: We Didn't Playtest This At All
item.comment: This is like Fluxx, but far better. It's incredibly quick and not tedious at all. I can't say I like it, but I'd play it. It's quick enough and quite silly. I can think of much better ways to kill 20 minutes than by playing 10 games of this.

item.name: Welcome to the Dungeon
item.comment: I see no reason to play this when you can just play Incan Gold which is better in every way.

item.name: Whac-A-Mole Card Game
item.comment:
Take Jungle Speed and then remove everything that makes it challenging. That's the Whac-A-Mole Card Game in a nutshell. Truth be told, this game is far too simple for adults. However, I think it might work fine for kids. Heck, maybe even a drinking game.
Christmas present for my wife in 2010.
Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: Where's Bob's Hat?
item.comment:
Bob's Hat is a bidding trick-taking game in the vein of Wizard, but a bit more silly and overall less fun. This game tends to run way too long as well. I will play Wizard any time over Bob's Hat.
Sold in my game auction December 2009

item.name: Wicked Witches Way
item.comment:
Purchased from FLGS in early 2009/late 2008
Gave to Charlotte to take back to England.

item.name: Wings of War: Burning Drachens
item.comment:
I felt like this should have been more fun. It's actually a total pain in the ass to keep track of where planes are and what they are doing. A lot of bookkeeping and fiddliness for not a lot of reward.
You spend half the time flying in circles hoping to catch the occassional glimpse of your opponent so you can fire. Sometimes your hits are deadly, sometimes useless. Either way, I'll pass.

item.name: WINK
item.comment: Surprisingly fun game that anyone can play.

item.name: Witch's Brew
item.comment: This is a great variation on trick-taking games. It completely blows Citadels out of the water and fills the same niche. I like this one.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment:
Purchased at 2007 WBC
This is the ultimate game for large groups. You really can't ask for more from a party game. As a party game, this is a perfect 10.

item.name: Wiz-War (eighth edition)
item.comment:
This game is awesome. It's like playing one of those multi-player shooter games in deathmatch mode but in a dungeon with wizards casting spells. Lots of fun, lots of interaction, lots of cool cards. This game is random and chaotic so if you want to bring strategy and tactics then forget it. Sit back, kill wizards, steal treasure, and have fun.
I've never played the old version but the new FFG one is great. Terrific components and a beautiful presentation.
Purchased at Dreamation on 2/25/12.

item.name: Wizard
item.comment:
This is a great trick-taking game that takes Spades and adds just a bit more to it without sacrificing it's simplicity. The ability to play with an extra player makes this a good choice for Spades fans to add to their collections.
Purchased from Time Warp Comics on 2/20/12

item.name: Wool Rules
item.comment:
Booooooooooring. If there's a decision to be made here, I'd love to know what it is. I'd play this with kids, but not with adults.
Traded away in Math Trade 2010

item.name: Wooly Bully
item.comment: A harmless tile-laying game that is neither good nor bad and as such is relegated to obscurity. I was hoping for more with this one, but it doesn't deliver the goods. Plus the luck factor feels really high.

item.name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game
item.comment: Purchased Fall of 2006

item.name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game
item.comment: I found this incredibly boring. Roll a die, move, fight, rinse and repeat. There's so much stuff on the board that its impossible to keep track of everything. This one could have been good, but in the end, I'll pass on this. I'd play it if there was nothing else to play, but I wouldn't be very happy about it.

item.name: W√ºrfel Bohnanza
item.comment:
There's really not much going on in this game. You roll dice and everyone gets to score while you're building an optimum dice pile to complete your own orders. It's alright, but it wasn't particularly fun. Maybe it was just the 2-player version.
Purchased from Game Surplus on 6/3/12
Traded in the July Math Trade.

item.name: WWE Raw Deal
item.comment:
It's a good game that captures wrestling pretty well. Unfortunately, the cards are incredibly wordy and that slows the game down a good bit.
Purchased a few decks for Luke and I for Christmas - 12/21/2011

item.name: Wyatt Earp
item.comment:
I found this to be a fun multi-player Rummy game. I can understand why some people get turned off by by the bullet-hole mechanism, but it doesn't bother me.
If you like Rummy games then this is a good choice.

item.name: The X-Files
item.comment:
Incredibly underrated and overlooked. There's a ton to like here: asymmetrical sides, co-op on one side, card management, timing, risk assessment, cat and mouse...
Read my full review here: [url]http://blog.cardboardinsanity.com/2015/03/a-review-of-x-files-or-this-chocolate.html[/url]

item.name: Yahtzee
item.comment:
A very simple dice game with a fun push-your-luck element. True, there's no skill here and it's obvious that getting the bonus on the top is paramount but I'd play this if asked. It could be a lot worse. There's actually some decisions to be made and I do like the tension. It's good enough that we'll play it.
Purchased as a stocking stuffer for my wife, Christmas 2011.

item.name: Yahtzee Free for All
item.comment:
This game felt like it could have been so much more. Instead, its just Yahtzee built with a central "take that" mechanism for scoring. There's a lot more player interaction than in Yahtzee, but it feels like the luck is more prevalent because you need to trump your opponents. Rolling 5 6's does no good if nobody else has a Yahtzee showing.
Give me the original, please.

item.name: Yggdrasil
item.comment:
I'm not a huge fan of co-ops, but this game is awesome. For starters, the graphics are beautiful. Whoever illustrated this deserves an award. Second, I love the mechanisms in the game, especially the bags. That just adds so much fun.
I'm a tad concerned about the length, but I think it will speed up with multiple plays.
I'm a big fan after one play, rating it a 7. I think this will climb but only more plays will tell.
Purchased from CSI 5/12/2011.
Sold in my game auction July 2011

item.name: YINSH
item.comment:
YINSH is a great game. It's a strange offshoot of Othello, but unique in many of it's features. This one is easy to play, but quite thinky.
A solid entry into the GIPF project, but not my favorite.

item.name: YN
item.comment:
This is a really unique takes on abstracts because the pieces change every time. 6 plays in and I'm not sure if it's good or great. I guess that will depend on what gets revealed through playing.
Received from the designer/publisher on 11/14/11 for review purposes.

item.name: Yspahan
item.comment: This one doesn't really work for me. I think getting first pick of the dice is a bit too lucky.

item.name: Z√àRTZ
item.comment: ZERTZ seems to be a game about forcing your opponents to make bad moves. To me, the game play feels backwards. Perhaps I've not played enough, but this one did not click for me.

item.name: ZigZag
item.comment:
A simple abstract game that is based on getting 4 pieces in a row. Its complicated by the way the pieces have to move and it creates some great strategy. I love the colors as it makes for a really catchy presentation during the game. This was $7 well spent.
Christmas present for my wife 2008

item.name: Zing!
item.comment:
A delicious trick-taking game which utilizes a very tough bidding system. I really do enjoy this one because it's very hard to hit your target.
I also love the introduction of the Saboteur who's only goal is to mess with the other players. Brilliant.
Traded away in 2011. Or so I thought. turns out I still have a copy of this somehow. Whatevs, glad I do!
And now it's actually traded, August 2012.

item.name: Zip-It
item.comment:
A simpler, faster version of Bananagrams. It's smaller and takes up much less space which makes it a great travel game. If you like word games and want something really portable this is a great choice.
Received a copy from the Bananagrams booth at DexCon 07/10/11.
Sold in my game auction 12/2011.

item.name: Zombie Dice
item.comment:
Zombie Dice really is incredibly simple and boring yet if I had 10 minutes to kill I would play it. But I think 10 minutes is about all its good for and anything over that would become tedious very quickly.
I also think the game is horrendously overpriced for 13 very simple 6-sided dice.

item.name: Zombie Fluxx
item.comment:
Fluxx is a fine game and the Zombie version is exactly the same game, but with zombies. It's fun and silly.
The downside to Fluxx is that it has a lot of downtime. There's so many cards coming in at the start of every turn and it just bogs the game down as everyone reads what they've got. From now on I'll play that cards are drawn at the end of the turn. That should help quite a bit.

item.name: Zombie in my Pocket
item.comment:
A fun little solo experience. Very light on rules and not really too many decisions, but it's quite fun. I enjoyed my two plays quite a bit. I'll likely pick up the Cambridge release when it comes out.
Recommended for anyone with 10 minutes to kill.

item.name: Zombie State: Diplomacy of the Dead
item.comment:
I'm mixed on this one. The zombie eating and movement rules are awesome, I really like how that works. I also love the population dice. Even the tech tree is kind of cool, although I'm positive that Quarantine is overpowered.
The biggest flaw is downtime of which there is a lot. You will likely sit there for 10 minutes doing nothing which is a bit lame. Also, the fact that failing a tech check costs you all the cards is brutal. Fail 2 and you're likely done for.
The game is so long for what it is but I like it. I wish it was about 90 minutes maximum and then it would likely be perfect.

item.name: Zombiegeddon
item.comment:
Purchased at DexCon in summer of 09
Owned twice. The art is simply too horrendous to stay in my collection.

item.name: Zombies!!!
item.comment: Keep up the fight, Todd.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment:
This game takes the excellent Coloretto mechanism and puts an actual game around it. This is a fairly simple game with some decisions to be made. It looks good and is family friendly.
I'm not crazy about it but I'd play it if asked.

item.name: Zooloretto: The Dice Game
item.comment:
A very quick dice game that actually has a bunch of choices. There's lots of little choices that come together to make a difference. I like how you can spoil trucks for other players. The one thing I'm not sure of is how the trucks are opened up once the dice are taken. I think that makes it too easy for the last player to roll the dice and get out of a bad roll. In Coloretto, you lose the card rows as they're taken so I think I'll try this game with that rule.
A birthday present from my awesome wife, 5/7/12.
